title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Company Description**

**About CyberArk**:  
CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on X, LinkedIn or Facebook.

 **Job Description**

CyberArk is seeking a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with a passion for sales strategy and business insight to join our Business Analytics team. In this role, you will act as a strategic partner to Sales and Sales Operations leaders around the globe—translating data into compelling narratives that drive better, faster decisions. You’ll play a key role in shaping how performance is measured, understood, and improved across our global go-to-market (GTM) organization. While you’ll contribute to dashboard development and scalable reporting in Tableau, this role goes far beyond building reports—you’ll be expected to uncover trends, connect dots across complex datasets, and communicate insights in a way that resonates with non-technical audiences. The ideal candidate is a business-minded analyst with strong sales acumen, excellent communication skills, and an instinct for asking the right questions to get to the heart of the problem.

**Responsibilities:**

* Serve as an embedded analytics partner to global Sales and Sales Operations stakeholders, proactively identifying opportunities to improve pipeline, productivity, and conversion
* Craft clear, executive-ready narratives based on deep-dive analyses of sales performance, pipeline coverage, segmentation, and revenue trends
* Translate complex data and technical concepts into actionable recommendations that are easy for non-technical stakeholders to understand and act upon
* Design and evolve self-service dashboards and tools in Tableau that reduce friction and enable faster time-to-decision
* Maintain a high bar for data accuracy and consistency across reports and ad hoc deliverables
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, RevOps, Marketing, Finance, and IT to align on business definitions and ensure reliable analytics infrastructure
* Help drive a data-driven culture by enabling stakeholders to interpret KPIs and use insights effectively

#LI-JA1

#LI-Hybrid

 **Qualifications**  

* 4–6 years of experience in Sales Analytics, Sales Operations, Business Intelligence, or a related field
* Proven ability to extract and communicate insights from complex data—especially in a Sales or GTM environment
* Strong business judgment, with experience working directly with senior stakeholders and cross-functional teams
* Working knowledge of SQL and experience with Tableau or a similar BI platform (depth of tool expertise less important than the ability to learn quickly)
* Understanding of B2B sales metrics, pipeline stages, and CRM data (Salesforce experience a plus)
* Excellent storytelling skills—both written and verbal—with the ability to tailor messages to executive and frontline audiences
* Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and isn’t afraid to ask questions or challenge assumptions
* Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business-related field
* Smart, bold but humble attitude to work collaboratively with CyberArk colleagues

  
**Additional Information**

CyberArk is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.

The salary range for this position is $87,000 – $121,000/year, plus commissions or discretionary bonus, which will be based on the employee’s performance. Base pay may also vary considerably depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The compensation package includes a wide range of medical, dental, vision, financial, and other benefits.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Position: Business Analyst**

**Duration: 12 Months**

**Location: Houston, TX**

**Position Summary:**

The Business Analyst provides critical support to both internal departments and external stakeholders by facilitating communication, analyzing business needs, and ensuring the successful execution of operational and strategic initiatives.

This role at Organization ensures that projects and processes are aligned with organizational goals and stakeholder expectations.

**Duties & Responsibilities: % of Time**

* Stakeholder Communication: Serves as a primary liaison between internal teams and external partners/vendors to ensure clear, timely communication on projects and initiatives. 30%

* Business Process Analysis: Analyzes current operational workflows and identifies opportunities for improvement, efficiency, or automation. 20%

* Requirement Gathering: Conducts interviews and workshops to gather business, functional, and technical requirements from stakeholders. 15%

* Cross-Departmental Coordination: Collaborates with IT, operations, customer service, and leadership teams to align business objectives and resolve cross-functional issues. 15%

* Reporting & Documentation: Develops reports, dashboards, and executive summaries to track KPIs, project progress, and stakeholder engagement. 10%

* Presentation & Support: Prepares materials and presentations for meetings, briefings, and leadership updates.

**Essential Skills Required:**

* Strong interpersonal and stakeholder engagement skills

* Ability to translate complex technical concepts into user-friendly language

* Solid understanding of business analysis methodologies and tools

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

* Ability to manage multiple priorities and shifting timelines

* High attention to detail with a problem-solving mindset

* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint

* Familiarity with project management or business analysis tools (e.g., JIRA, Smartsheet, Visio)

**Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities:**

* Strong interpersonal and stakeholder engagement skills

* Ability to translate complex technical concepts into user-friendly language

* Solid understanding of business analysis methodologies and tools

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

* Ability to manage multiple priorities and shifting timelines

* High attention to detail with a problem-solving mindset

* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint

* Familiarity with project management or business analysis tools (e.g., JIRA, Smartsheet, Visio)

Job Type: Contract

Work Location: In person

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in analyzing business needs, identifying solutions, and enhancing overall operational efficiency. This position requires strong data analysis skills and proficiency in various analytical tools to support decision-making processes within the organization.

**Duties**

* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements.
* Analyze data trends and patterns to provide actionable insights.
* Utilize tools such as Python, R, and Talend for data manipulation and analysis.
* Create visual representations of data findings using software like Visio.
* Develop comprehensive reports that communicate findings effectively to diverse audiences.
* Monitor project progress and ensure alignment with business objectives.
* Conduct regular reviews of business processes to identify areas for improvement.
* Facilitate workshops and meetings to discuss project updates and gather feedback.

**Experience**

* Proven experience in business analysis or a related field.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
* Familiarity with analytics tools and programming languages such as Python and R.
* Experience with data integration tools like Talend is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings clearly.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment while also being self-motivated.

Join us as we strive to enhance our business operations through insightful analysis and innovative solutions. If you possess the required skills and are eager to contribute to our success, we encourage you to apply.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Health insurance

* 8 hour shift

title: Business Analyst (ITIL Configuration)
description:
**Job Overview:**

* The configuration manager oversees the configuration management process, as a key function within the IT Service Management team, ensuring all configuration items (CI) are accurately documented and maintained.
* This individual is responsible for establishing and maintaining the configuration management plan and coordinating with various IT teams to enforce CM practices.
* Their work involves defining configuration identifications, managing configuration changes, and conducting reviews & audits to ensure compliance with HHS agency policies and standards.
* The configuration manager must ensure that CM tools and resources are used effectively.
* They act as a bridge between operations, infrastructure, applications, and ITSM teams to guarantee that everyone is aligned with the CM strategy.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies.
* Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective.
* Familiar with industry standard business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc.
* Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.

**EXPERIENCE-**

**Required Qualifications & Skills:**

* ***5 Years:*** Advanced knowledge of ITIL configuration management principles and best practices; prior experience in developing and maintaining configuration management process & polices.
* ***5 Years:*** Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills and a strong attention to detail.
* ***5 Years:*** Experience supporting and maintaining CMDB platforms such as BMC Helix, ServiceNow, Atlassian, etc.
* ***4 Years:*** Performs regular configuration audits to verify their completeness, accuracy, and compliance with the CM plan and system objectives.
* ***4 Years:*** Responsible for verifying and auditing the configuration status and assists with configuration verification, to ensure that the CIs are consistent with their specifications and requirements.
* ***4 Years:*** 3-5 years of demonstrated work experience as a Configuration Manager or a similar role overseeing IT Service Management processes & standards.
* ***4 Years:*** ITIL 4 Foundation certification.

**Contract Details:**

* The primary work location(s) will be at **4601 W. Guadalupe St. Austin, TX 78751**.
* The working position is Hybrid. ***Position will be 3 days remote with 2 days (Tuesdays and Thursdays) required to be onsite at the location listed above. Program will only accept LOCAL ONLY candidates for this position.***
* Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the **Texas Health and Human Services Commission**. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from **8:00 AM to 5:00 PM**, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed.
* Services are expected to start **07/21/2025** and are expected to complete by **08/31/2025**. Total estimated hours per Candidate shall not exceed **280** hours. This service may be amended, renewed, and/or extended providing both parties agree to do so in writing.
* ***S# 529501430***

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $45.00 - $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* ITIL configuration management principles: 5 years (Required)
* maintaining CMDB platforms: BMC Helix & ServiceNow: 5 years (Required)

title: Chief Financial Officer for Milwaukee College Prep
description:
**ORGANIZATION OVERVIEW**

Founded in 1997, Milwaukee College Prep (MCP) is a leading network of four K4-8th grade public charter schools that every child in Milwaukee is eligible to attend free of charge. This year they added K3 to one of our campuses — they know that high quality early childhood education can be transformational when done right. They now provide K3 programming to 100 young scholars at our MCP: Lola Rowe North Campus. No matter the age or the campus, MCP schools live our mission; “knowledge plus character pave the road to college and beyond.” Milwaukee College Prep is absolutely determined to provide equal parts academic rigor and character development so that our scholars have the foundation necessary to determine their own destinies. They absolutely believe, and research supports, that an uncompromising K-8 education taught by an exceptional team of teachers is the difference between dreams realized and dreams denied. If a child can’t read, problem-solve, draw inferences, think critically, be self-disciplined and self-determined, that child will not realize his or her dreams…he or she won’t even come close. Having determined, loving, master teachers in every classroom makes the difference. MCP ensures that the classroom is at the center of all its work.

**MISSION ALIGNMENT**

The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) provides strategic and operational leadership of all financial functions at Milwaukee College Prep (MCP), ensuring the school network’s long-term fiscal sustainability, regulatory compliance, and operational excellence. As a key member of the Executive Leadership Team, the CFO advises the CEO, President, and Board of Directors and plays a critical role in driving mission-aligned financial strategy to support academic and organizational goals.

· Champion MCP’s mission and core values — Trust, Respect, Empathy, Courage, and Kindness — in all financial leadership, decisions, and partnerships.

· Strategic Financial Leadership

· Lead the development and execution of long-term financial strategies that support organizational growth, innovation, and impact.

· Serve as a key advisor to the CEO, President, and Board on all financial matters, ensuring data-informed decision-making and fiscal discipline.

· Incorporate scenario planning and forecasting to navigate enrollment shifts, economic conditions, and potential funding changes. Communicates and maintains positive working relationships with external parties providing financial services, including banks, lenders, investment advisors, insurance companies, investment bankers, and associated governmental agencies.

To learn more, please visit https://www.milwaukeecollegeprep.com/

**POSITION OVERVIEW**

The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) provides strategic and operational leadership of all financial functions at Milwaukee College Prep (MCP), ensuring the school network’s long-term fiscal sustainability, regulatory compliance, and operational excellence. As a key member of the Executive Leadership Team, the CFO advises the CEO, President, and Board of Directors and plays a critical role in driving mission-aligned financial strategy to support academic and organizational goals.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Financial Operations & Oversight**

· Direct all accounting, financial reporting, forecasting, and audit functions.

· Ensure timely, accurate, and transparent reporting to internal and external stakeholders.

· Develop and monitor financial KPIs and ROIs to evaluate performance and guide course corrections.

**Regulatory Compliance & Risk Management**

· Ensure full compliance with all federal, state, and local financial regulations, including those related to charter schools and public funding.

· Oversee grant management, government contracting, and audit readiness.

· Proactively assess and manage financial risk to protect both organizational and financial integrity.

**Budgeting, Equity, & Resource Allocation**

· Execute the annual budgeting process, aligning resources with MCP’s strategic priorities.

· Ensure budgeting, resource allocation and diversification efforts reflect MCP’s commitment to equity, excellence, and access for all students.

· Provide clear, actionable financial insights to department leaders and school principals to inform site-level decision-making.

**Team Development & Leadership**

· Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing finance team aligned with MCP’s values and commitment to excellence.

· Set clear performance expectations and support ongoing development and professional growth.

**Collaboration & Change Leadership**

· Collaborate with fellow executives to ensure financial strategy supports academic and operational goals.

· Lead cross-functional change initiatives that improve efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and mission impact.

**Board & Stakeholder Engagement**

· Serve as the primary liaison to the Board Finance Committee, providing clear, strategic financial reporting and recommendations.

· Build strong relationships with funders, financial institutions, and oversight agencies (e.g., DPI, charter authorizer).

**Process Improvement & Systems Optimization**

· Evaluate and improve financial systems, processes, and technologies to increase efficiency and accuracy.

· Identify and implement best practices that enhance internal controls and resource stewardship.

**Vendor & Resource Management**

Lead financial aspects of procurement strategy and vendor relationships, ensuring quality, cost-effectiveness, and alignment with MCP needs.

**Technology & Data Systems**

· Oversee the implementation and use of financial systems (e.g., ERP, dashboards, data tools) to support informed decision-making and reporting.

· Leverage technology to effectively drive transparency, accountability, and automation in financial operations.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

· Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or a related field; MBA preferred.

· Prior experience managing equitable funding strategies across diverse communities.

· Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree preferred.

· Minimum of 8 years of progressive financial leadership, or equivalent, experience.

· Successful financial leadership in organizations operating under government-funded programs (e.g., charter schools, Title I).

· Proficiency in financial software systems, including spreadsheet modeling and ERP platforms (e.g., Sage Intacct, NetSuite).

\\*Please note that comptrollers, finance directors, and others, are encouraged to apply.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ATTRIBUTES**

· Deep alignment with MCP’s mission and a personal commitment to educational equity.

· Experience working with WI Department of Public Instruction, MPS, and School Nutrition Programs is desirable.

· Track record of managing cash flow and forecasting in complex financial environments.

· Strong strategic planning, analytical thinking, and interpersonal communication skills.

· Demonstrated success in preparing and presenting financial reports and communicating organizational financial position with clarity and confidence.

· Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver assignments on time.

· Ability to influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization and with external stakeholders.

· Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with an ability to build and maintain relationships across a diverse community.

· Positive attitude and commitment to being a collaborative and reliable teammate.

**COMMITMENTS FROM MILWAUKEE COLLEGE PREP**

Milwaukee College Prep is an equal opportunity employer. Personnel administration in the school shall be conducted so as not to discriminate of the basis of age, race, creed, color, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression national origin disability, political affiliation, handicap, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, arrest or conviction record, membership in the national guard, stat defense force or any other reserve component of the military forces of the United State of Wisconsin, use or nonuse of lawful products off school premises during non-working hours, or other reason prohibited by state or federal law. This policy shall apply to hiring, placement, assignment, seniority, transfer promotion, lay-off, recall or termination. Similarly, all salaries, wages, benefit programs and personnel policies shall be administered in conformity with this policy. Reasonable accommodations shall be made for qualified individuals with a disability or handicap, unless such accommodations would impose an undue hardship to the school. If you believe you have been discriminated against in violation of this policy, you may file a complaint. Responsibility for overseeing the school’s equal employment opportunity and affirmative action programs and investigating discrimination complaints is assigned to the Chief People Officer (Formerly HR Director). Milwaukee College Prep offers a generous 403(b) retirement plan, a generous health care plan including dental and vision, tuition reimbursement, professional development reimbursement, student loan reimbursement, and school paid Life and AD&D insurance.

References will not be contacted until a candidate has been notified. Background checks will subsequently be performed. All inquiries and interactions with potential candidates are kept in strict confidence. The position will remain open until filled.

**INSTRUCTIONS FOR APPLICANTS**

For full consideration, please apply here: https://www.paycomonline.net/v4/ats/web.php/jobs/ViewJobDetails?job=22678&clientkey=ED7FE791F1E19827B6098A2D9B4961E1https://www.paycomonline.net/v4/ats/web.php/jobs/ViewJobDetails?job=22678&clientkey=ED7FE791F1E19827B6098A2D9B4961E1 no later than 5:00 p.m. CT on July 11, 2025.

*Leading Transitions is committed to the vitality and growth of mission-based, nonprofit, philanthropic, and community-centered efforts and organizations, and their leaders. The firm’s inclusive practices provide the flexibility and creativity necessary to adapt to the intricacies and dynamics of any community.* *We believe that periods of change are transformational and bring new diverse opportunities*.

**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a highly skilled and strategic Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to join our executive team. The CFO will be responsible for overseeing all financial aspects of the company, providing leadership in financial planning, analysis, and reporting. This role requires a deep understanding of both GAAP and IFRS standards, as well as expertise in governmental accounting and technical accounting. The ideal candidate will possess strong business analysis skills and be adept at financial modeling and forecasting to drive the company's financial strategy.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement financial strategies that align with the company's goals and objectives.
* Oversee the preparation of accurate financial reports in compliance with GAAP and IFRS standards.
* Manage payroll processes to ensure timely and accurate compensation for all employees.
* Conduct comprehensive business analysis to identify opportunities for growth and cost savings.
* Lead financial planning efforts, including budgeting, forecasting, and long-term financial modeling.
* Ensure compliance with governmental accounting regulations and reporting requirements.
* Provide insights on financial performance to the executive team and board of directors.
* Collaborate with other departments to support overall business objectives through effective financial management.
* Monitor cash flow, investment strategies, and risk management practices to safeguard company assets.

**Experience**

* Proven experience as a CFO or in a similar senior financial leadership role within a dynamic organization.
* Extensive knowledge of GAAP, IFRS, governmental accounting, technical accounting, and payroll management practices.
* Strong background in financial planning, forecasting, business analysis, and financial modeling techniques.
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and provide actionable insights.
* Exceptional leadership abilities with a track record of building high-performing finance teams.
* Strong communication skills to effectively present financial information to stakeholders at all levels.

Join our team as we strive for excellence in our financial operations while fostering an environment of growth and innovation!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $46,050.70 - $55,458.91 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Work Location: In person

title: Data/Business Analyst
description:
Nature’s Way Farms is one of the largest tropical shrub and ornamental nurseries in Florida. We have more than 40 years of experience growing plants on hundreds of acres. We service garden centers in large mass market retailers across the country. We are looking for an addition to our production planning team.

**Responsibilities**  
The Analyst will be responsible for data manipulation, validation, and analysis to support plant production. A significant portion of the role involves extensive data handling in Excel, along with entry-level interpretation and analysis. The Analyst will ensure the integrity and accuracy of data through regular audits and reviews. Attention to detail is essential for identifying discrepancies and making necessary adjustments, ensuring all data is precise and reliable.

**Qualifications**

· The role requires in-office attendance Monday through Friday.

· A Bachelor's degree in business, mathematics, finance, data science, or a related field, or relevant experience in data analysis.

· Advanced proficiency in Excel is required.

· Some prior office experience, including internships, is preferred.

· Strong attention to detail and the ability to handle repetitive administrative tasks. A proactive mindset with a desire to learn, experiment, and take calculated risks is crucial for success and career growth.

· Ability to work outdoors to observe and understand products is required.

· Bilingual in Spanish and English is a significant advantage.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage applications from candidates regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status. We believe that diversity enriches our work culture and enhances our ability to serve our customers and partners.

Nature's Way Farms is proud to maintain a drug-free workplace. Our commitment to maintaining a drug-free environment extends not only to our employees' safety but also to upholding our professional standards and promoting a positive work atmosphere.

www.natureswaymiami.com

title: District Manager, Neuroscience - Miami, FL
description:
**Company Description**

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

 **Job Description**

Purpose

Coordinate commercial activity within in-field teams to ensure targets are reached for increasing sales within an assigned geography. Create, implement, and communicate District Sales Plan and monitor progress.

Responsibilities

Coordinate in-field activity to achieve results and agreed-upon targets. Maximize market, segment, and team dynamics to drive both top- and bottom-line results. Ensure smooth, collaborative efforts in both day to day and long term business execution. Set tone and pace for business process and organization.

* Understand and present a market and franchise/business point of view when leading teams and championing in-field meeting by developing a mastery of product and disease state information, as well as pertinent Market dynamics, including Managed Care landscape.
* Coach, mentor, educate and develop direct and indirect team members to enhance individual skills and elevate overall team performance. Hold direct reports accountable to behaviors and expectations.
* Provide direction and insights to key internal partners in business planning process.
* Consistently exemplify the AbbVie Ways of Working.

  
**Qualifications**

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in health, sciences, pharmacy or business-related field preferred or relevant and equivalent industry experience required.

* Business analysis and planning skills that drive sales performance. Excellent judgment and decision making skills.
* Ability to articulate the scientific aspects of treatments and therapeutic areas.
* Proven ability to deliver candid, effective feedback and efficiently manage performance. Ability to develop talent for promotional opportunities. Ability to create a culture of winning and full team engagement.
* Collaborates and is able to influence without authority across organizations. Models AbbVie’s Ways of Working.
* An essential requirement of your position is to satisfy all applicable health care industry representative (HCIR) credentialing requirements to gain and maintain entry into facilities and organizations that are in your assigned territory. You must also be in good standing and/or eligible to obtain these credentials.
* These HCIR credentialing requirements may include, but are not limited to, background checks, drug screens, proof of immunization/vaccination for various diseases, fingerprinting and specific licenses required by individual state or cities. Please remember that you are solely responsible for ensuring that you satisfy all HCIR credentialing requirements and for any associated liability for failing to do so. to AbbVie has resources to answer questions you may have regarding your responsibilities.

This range may be modified in the future.

title: Business Systems Analyst Senior
description:
**Job Overview**  
*Note: This position is contingent upon contract award. Synergistic Agility is seeking qualified candidates to be part of a proposal submission for a federal contract with a federal agency. Employment offers will be extended only if the contract is awarded to our team.*

We are seeking a detail-oriented and mission-driven **Senior Business Systems Analyst** to join our federal IT services team. In this role, you will analyze current federal business processes, recommend IT solutions, and support enterprise system modernization using Agile methodologies. Your analytical insights and technical coordination will help shape system enhancements that improve operational outcomes and ensure mission alignment.

**Responsibilities**

* Analyze complex business processes across HR, financial, and health IT systems to identify gaps and opportunities.
* Collaborate with technical teams and government stakeholders to translate business needs into functional system requirements.
* Participate in Agile ceremonies, providing expertise in backlog refinement and user story definition.
* Assist in the design and integration of enterprise applications and ERP systems.
* Develop system documentation, including process flows, requirements traceability, and test plans.
* Support system configuration reviews, upgrades, and system assessments.
* Ensure solutions align with federal IT policies, including FISMA, FedRAMP, and Section 508 compliance.
* Communicate technical information clearly to business and non-technical stakeholders.
* Partner with DevOps teams to align user needs with release planning and automation.

**Experience**

* Proven experience as a Business Systems Analyst supporting federal programs, ERP systems, or enterprise application environments.
* Strong understanding of Agile project delivery and backlog management.
* Familiarity with IT infrastructure, system integration, and federal compliance standards.
* Ability to conduct gap analyses and define system-to-be states aligned with mission needs.
* Experience supporting business case development and documenting functional specs.

**Qualifications**

* **Bachelor’s degree** in Business, Information Systems, or related field.
* **5+ years** of business systems analysis experience.
* Experience with Jira, Confluence, and Agile tools is preferred.
* Federal experience (HHS, CMS) is highly desirable.

Join us in driving innovation through effective business analysis while contributing to the success of our organization!

Job Type: Contract

title: Sr. Business Analyst (AI)
description:
The Senior Business Analyst will join a team to lead the requirements gathering and business analysis work for an application development team building AI solutions for a federal government agency. They will be the primary point of contact to the customer, facilitating ideation, requirements, and working sessions to plan, design, and develop AI solutions to drive efficiencies into existing government systems and processes. The Senior BA will bring strong analytical, communication, and technical skills to bridge the gap between business stakeholders and the technical team. They will independently gather and document business requirements / user stories, create workflows and Visio diagrams, and facilitate the successful delivery of AI-driven solutions. Responsibilties include:

* Facilitate requirements workshops, stakeholder meetings, and regular status updates to ensure clarity and progress
* Create and update user stories throughout the Agile development process
* Identify opportunities for leveraging AI to improve business processes and operations.
* Develop and maintain process workflows, diagrams, and visual representations of requirements using tools such as Microsoft Visio.
* Collaborate with the technical team to design and implement AI-driven solutions, ensuring alignment with business objectives

Projected compensation range for this position is $120K - $140K. The final salary offered will generally fall within this range and is determined by various factors, including but not limited to the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as internal pay equity, location, contract-specific affordability and other organizational requirements.

Required Skills

* 8+ years of business analysis for IT systems
* Strong working knowledge of AI tools and technology
* Proven experience in a senior BA role, independently working with business users and driving IT development work
* Experience working within Agile development teams
* Experience gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements / user stories from stakeholders across various departments
* Must be a US Citizen

Desirable Skills

* Experience working for federal government customers
* Active Fedeal Government Public Trust clearance
* AI related certifications
* Certified Scrum Master;

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Compensation Package:

* Yearly pay

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Washington, DC 20426

title: Accela Senior Business Analyst
description:
Link Technologies (LinkTechConsulting.com), a Las Vegas-based IT consulting firm, is currently seeking an Accela Senior Business Analyst to join our team.

***JOB SUMMARY***  
This position serves as a liaison between business users, functional subject matter experts, systems analysts, and technical developers. Responsibilities include analyzing business processes by assessing current and future state process flows, documenting process diagrams, eliciting and documenting requirements, performing system fit/gap analysis, contributing to design specifications, developing and overseeing technology-related request for proposals, and participating in systems testing. As a key member of technology services, this role contributes to delivering high customer value through innovative solutions and plays a crucial part in exceeding customer expectations.

***QUALIFICATIONS***

* Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, mathematics or a related field. o Additional appropriate type and level of experience may be substituted for the minimum education requirement on a one (1) year for one (1) year basis.

***Minimum of five (5) years of recent, professional-level experience in business analysis, including at least two (2) years in a lead role on projects of varying sizes. This experience should include:***

* Leading process analysis and improvement initiatives that span multiple teams or departments.
* Identifying and delivering enterprise-wide system enhancement recommendations.
* Conducting technical evaluations in complex, highly integrated software system environments.
* Developing process and system diagrams to document current and future state operations.
* Producing end-user training documentation or converting technical content into training materials.
* Creating process handoff and system integration diagrams across interconnected systems.
* Collaborating effectively with peers, customers, and vendors to achieve shared outcomes.
* Assisting both technical and non-technical stakeholders in understanding the impact of process handoffs on requirements and system integrations.
* Clearly documenting workflows for use by internal teams and organizational leadership.
* Defining requirements to integrate new tools into existing technical infrastructure.

***ADDITIONAL SKILLS REQUIRED***

* Must be able to obtain CJIS Certification within 90 days from start date.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Highly self-motivated with strong organizational abilities.
* Focused on delivering exceptional customer experiences.
* Proficient in facilitating customer interactions and engagements.
* Skilled in problem analysis and root cause identification.
* Effective in preparing and delivering presentations on a variety of topics.
* Experienced in building consensus and managing conflict.
* Capable of conducting successful negotiations.

***PREFERRED EXPERIENCE***

* Experience across a broad spectrum of technology solutions
* ITIL/ITSM
* Agile/Scrum
* Business Process Management (BPM)
* Lean Six Sigma / Lean process development
* Change Management
* Business case development and delivery
* Accela or similar workflow platforms
* Experience with AI tools is a plus
* Microsoft Office including Visio, Azure DevOps

***RESPONSIBILITIES***

* Act as principal liaison for business stakeholders and as a key point-of-contact to technology services, internal/external agencies, and vendors on their behalf.
* Facilitate team understanding and elicit requirements for systems, integrations, and future state functionality.
* Partner with business stakeholders to identify problems/opportunities, assist in developing these into project/initiatives, and work within technology services to move these into the project pipeline.
* Understand business processes and system capabilities for complex, integrated systems.
* Work with vendors to understand system intricacies and process needs to advocate for the best possible solution.
* Utilize Azure Dev Ops (ADO) for all project tracking purposes.
* Create functional process fit/gap analysis documentation which identifies and recommends resolution of any process, system, and integration related gaps.
* Make suggestions for any as-is or to-be processes which are lacking and/or present a risk and help mitigate them, before they become an issue.
* Follow TS best practices: documentation, project, and change management processes.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders, technology services teams, internal/external agencies, vendors, et. al to support the organization’s mission, vision, and goals.

***Pay range: $60-$65/hr***

Link Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other factors protected by law.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $60.00 - $65.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Westminster, CO 80031

title: Sales Operations Analyst
description:
**Company Description**

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**

**What you get to do in this role**:

* Aligned to several Americas regions and territories, the Sales Operations Specialist will support the forecasting process and advise the sales force in commercial sales transactions.
* Attend regional forecast calls and perform pipeline analysis to ensure forecast accuracy
* Analyze and review current customer licensing, products and usage and identify new revenue opportunities
* Suggest creative pricing and payment solutions balancing customer need and pricing policies.
* Review Quotes and Order Forms for accuracy and completeness.
* Ensure all Orders are approved within pricing and discount policies.
* Interface to Deals Desk, Finance and Legal as needed (i.e. revenue recognition)
* Interface with Order Management to ensure accuracy of booked sales opportunities in the ServiceNow sales automation tool.
* Support sales organization’s requirement for Customer licensing compliance

  
**Qualifications**

**To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* 1-2 years of proven experience of Sales Operations in a software sales organization
* Organized, with excellent attention to detail and the ability to work in a fast paced environment
* Proficient in PPT, Word, and Excel
* Experience with a CRM system
* Has been in a role supporting Sales Reps and Sales Territories
* Strong listening, analytic and organizational skills
* Ability to prioritize to meet business needs
* Effective communicator, both written and verbal
* Team Player with positive attitude ready to work in a fast paced environment
* Results Driven

JV20

For positions in this location, we offer a base pay of $78,200 - $121,300, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs. Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located and is subject to change based on work location.

 **Additional Information**

**Work Personas**

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Operations Analyst
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented **Operations Analyst** to support our Central Processing operations during tax season. This role is essential in ensuring a smooth and efficient workflow from client intake through final tax return delivery. You will be the operational backbone of the process—handling client documentation, managing data workflows, and facilitating accurate and timely tax return assembly.

**Responsibilities**

* Receive and manage incoming **digital and physical client documents** for tax preparation.
* Input client data accurately into our **online tax workflow portal** and track each stage of the process.
* Maintain clear and updated records for internal tracking and client communication.
* Assemble and package completed tax returns for client delivery—digitally and/or physically.
* Monitor document flow and flag missing or incomplete information proactively.
* Uphold the firm’s confidentiality and data security standards at every stage.

**Skills**

* **Extreme attention to detail** and a methodical, process-driven approach.
* **Strong organizational skills**—you are comfortable managing multiple tasks and deadlines.
* Tech-savvy with experience in digital document management systems, data entry, and workflow tools.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Prior experience in an operations, administrative, or processing role preferred—especially in a **tax, financial services, medical, or legal** setting.
* Comfortable working in a **fast-paced seasonal environment** with changing priorities.

**Technology & Tools**

* Experience with client portals, workflow tracking software, and Excel/Google Sheets.
* Familiarity with document scanning tools and PDF assembly is a plus.

Join us as we strive for excellence in operations through innovative analysis and strategic insights. We look forward to welcoming a proactive Operations Analyst who is eager to contribute to our success.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Pay: $22.50 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Finance Manager
description:
We’re hiring a **Senior Financial Business Analyst** to take ownership of our month-end close, inventory oversight, and core data systems. This is a roll-up-your-sleeves role for someone who is as confident reconciling accounts and analyzing reports as they are working with operations to improve how information flows through the company.

You’ll report directly to the President and manage key team members. Your impact will be visible, meaningful, and highly valued.

What You’ll Do

**Accounting & Finance**

* Lead the month-end close process including reconciliations, accruals, and journal entries
* Prepare monthly financial packages for leadership with insights and analysis
* Review daily transactions and invoices for accuracy in QuickBooks and ServiceTitan
* Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial decision-making

**Inventory & Data Oversight**

* Oversee material purchasing, staging, and inventory replenishment across trucks and warehouses
* Monitor job costing accuracy and ensure consistency
* Maintain clean, reliable master data across customers, pricing, jobs, locations, and inventory

**Systems & Process Management**

* Identify inefficiencies in operational or financial processes and propose practical solutions
* Ensure QuickBooks and ServiceTitan remain aligned and error-free
* Hold the team accountable to data accuracy and operational standards
* Become the company’s go-to expert for how business data is structured and used

**Team & Collaboration**

* Collaborate daily with the operations team to maintain job and inventory accuracy
* Take initiative to solve problems without requiring constant direction

**What We’re Looking For**

* 5+ years in finance, accounting, or operations roles
* Expert-level Excel skills (pivot tables, dashboards, data manipulation)
* Proficiency in QuickBooks; experience with ServiceTitan is a strong plus
* Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail
* Proactive, process-minded, and results-driven
* Comfortable working in a small, fast-paced business environment

**Compensation & Growth**

**Starting salary: $60,000-$75,000**, based on experience and ability to grow with the role.

We’re open to candidates who are ready to take the next step in their career and want meaningful ownership in a business poised for continued growth. Performance-based reviews and additional growth opportunities available.

description:
**Job description**

**Job Title:** Business Analyst – Ingenium (Life & Annuities)

**Location:** Remote  
**Experience:** 6+ Years  
**Industry:** Insurance – Life & Annuity  
**Employment Type:** Full Time

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst with strong expertise in **Ingenium**, a policy administration system (PAS) widely used in the Life & Annuity (L&A) insurance domain. The ideal candidate should possess a deep understanding of insurance business processes, policy lifecycle, and should be comfortable working in cross-functional teams to support digital transformation, system enhancements, and integration projects.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Gather and document business requirements, user stories, and process flows related to Ingenium PAS.
* Collaborate with business users, solution architects, and technical teams to translate business needs into functional specifications.
* Perform gap analysis between current system capabilities and desired business processes.
* Support system configuration, data mapping, and integration between Ingenium and other internal/external systems.
* Assist in test planning, creating test cases, and supporting UAT activities.
* Create and maintain documentation such as BRDs, FRDs, process models, and training materials.
* Participate in Agile ceremonies (Scrum, Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming) and contribute to backlog refinement.
* Liaise with QA, developers, and stakeholders to ensure smooth delivery and issue resolution.

**Required Skills & Experience:**

* 6+ years of experience as a Business Analyst in the Life & Annuity insurance domain.
* Strong hands-on experience with **Ingenium PAS** (system workflows, batch processing, policy transactions, etc.).
* Solid understanding of policy lifecycle – new business, underwriting, policy issuance, servicing, claims, and termination.
* Experience with mainframe systems and knowledge of COBOL-based environments (preferred).
* Familiarity with data models, SQL, and reporting tools.
* Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Exposure to Agile methodology and tools like JIRA, Confluence, etc.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Insurance, or a related field.
* Knowledge of other PAS tools like wmA, LifeComm, CyberLife, or Vantage-One is a plus.
* Certifications like IIBA CBAP, Scrum Master, or Agile BA are desirable.

Pay: $51,107.27 - $90,720.57 per year

Schedule:

title: Business Operations Associate / Analyst

GuardianVets partners with veterinary hospitals to virtually offload front desk duties such as triaging cases and scheduling appointments. We are looking for a results-driven and analytical Operations Associate for our fast-growing veterinary telehealth business.

Job responsibilities include:

* Budget management

* Project management

* Evaluating team effectiveness and performance
* Assisting with process re-engineering

This is a great opportunity to join a fast-growing business in a leadership position.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are essential for this position. Ability to think outside the box and create new ways of doing things. Experience in the veterinary field is a plus, but not required.

Being able to work in our Chicago office is strongly preferred but if you are in another state and qualified for the position you are welcome to apply!

title: On-site Power BI Data Analyst (1099 Contractor)
description:
**Company Description**

At Abramson Labor Group, we're not just committed to defending employee rights—we're passionate about it. Whether you're up against a small business or a corporate giant, our highly skilled team of attorneys and legal professionals are ready to fight for you. Headquartered in vibrant Burbank, California, we focus on exclusively protecting employees throughout the entire state of beautiful California. Our dedicated attorneys, paralegals and legal assistants work tirelessly to secure the justice you deserve in all workplace disputes. We pride ourselves on delivering top-notch solutions with integrity, efficiency, and professionalism. Choose Abramson Labor Group and let us champion your cause with unwavering dedication.

 **Job Description**

**Job Title: Power BI Data Analyst (1099 Contractor)**  
**Location:** On-site – Burbank, CA  
**Employment Type:** 1099 Contractor  
**Duration:** 3–8 months  
**Schedule:** Monday – Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:30 PM PST  
**Compensation:** $40-50 hourly

**About the Role**

Abramson Labor Group is seeking a **Power BI Expert** to join our team on a contract basis to support our business intelligence and data reporting needs. This is a temporary in-person position based at our Burbank, CA office, with a project duration of approximately 3 to 8 months.

The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in Power BI and a passion for turning complex data into actionable insights. You will be responsible for building a variety of interactive reports and dashboards, extracting and consolidating data from multiple sources, and translating business requirements into analytical solutions.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and maintain visually compelling and interactive Power BI dashboards and reports.
* Gather, clean, and transform data from various internal and external sources.
* Analyze large datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and business opportunities.
* Present clear, concise, and actionable insights to stakeholders across departments.
* Collaborate with internal teams to understand reporting needs and deliver customized solutions.
* Troubleshoot and optimize data models, reports, and performance issues as needed.

 **Qualifications**

**Qualifications & Skills**

* Proven expertise in **Microsoft Power BI** with a strong portfolio of past dashboards and reports.
* Solid understanding of **data analysis**, **data modeling**, and **DAX functions**.
* Experience in **data gathering**, integration, and transformation from diverse sources (e.g., Excel, SQL, APIs).
* Excellent **problem-solving skills** and high attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
* Strong communication skills for effective presentation of findings and collaboration with team members.

**Additional Information**

* This is a **1099 contractor role** and is not eligible for benefits.
* Must be able to **work in-person** at our Burbank office during the specified hours.
* Project estimated to run between **3 to 8 months**, depending on business needs.

**To Apply:**  
Please submit your resume and any relevant work samples or portfolio showcasing your Power BI experience (if you have any).

 **Additional Information**

**Department**

IT

**Employment Type**

Contract (3-8 months)

**Location**

Burbank, CA

**Workplace type**

Onsite

**Compensation**

$40 - $50 hourly
company_description: Abramson Labor Group is here to fight against any employer, large or small, to defend employee rights. We are an experienced and award-winning Law Firm specialized in Employment Law.

title: Technology Coordinator
description:
Legal Services NYC (LSNYC) fights poverty and seeks racial, social and economic justice for low-income New Yorkers. For over 50 years, we have challenged systemic injustices that trap people in poverty and provided legal services that help our clients meet basic needs for housing, income and economic security, family and immigration stability, education, and health care. LSNYC is the largest civil legal services provider in the country; our staff of more than 600 people in neighborhood-based offices and outreach sites across all five boroughs helps hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers annually. We partner with scores of community-based and client-run organizations, elected officials, public agencies, pro bono lawyers, and the courts to maximize our effectiveness. Our work fights discrimination and helps to achieve equity for all low-income New Yorkers.

LSNYC employees have numerous opportunities for growth and professional development, including access to our internal Justice Learning Center, which provides opportunities to earn free CLEs and gain experience as a trainer.

**The Opportunity**

LSNYC is seeking a full-time **Technology Coordinator** to lead and support significant technology initiatives across the application development and technology support. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in managing technology-driven projects, improving business processes using AI driven technology, and enhancing legal service delivery through innovative solutions. The Technology Coordinator will report directly to the IT Director, and will principally work out of LSNYC’s Central Office in lower Manhattan. Periodic work will be done in all boroughs of New York City. This position offers an exciting opportunity to make a meaningful impact on LSNYC’s technology landscape while supporting access to justice through innovation.

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Project Management & Implementation:** Work under the direction of the IT application director and CIO to manage projects or work items (assigned by them) which can be part of a bigger project. The person must have some business analysis, project coordination/management background and some development experience. The candidate should be comfortable in constantly learning new technology.
* **Technology Research & Development:** Analyze, propose, and implement technology-related projects that enhance service delivery and administrative functions. The candidate must have programming knowledge, experience in implementing AI technology and background to perform simple hands-on configuration and development work if needed although the majority of the development is done by vendors. However, the candidate must have the technical ability to own and manage the application once it has been developed and handed over by the vendors.
* **Technology Leadership:** Provide strategic direction in developing and deploying technologies that improve legal work and organizational efficiency. Work under the direction of the application development director and be able to provide feasible and effective technical solutions to problems. Ability to work in AI driven initiatives and process automation tools. Have an in-depth understanding of modern technology and the different integration frameworks. Ability to work in cloud technology and have a good understanding of the cloud architecture.
* **Process Improvement:** Identify and implement technology solutions to optimize LSNYC’s business processes. Ability to analyze an existing process and identify problems. Work under the Director to come up with solutions to improve the process.
* **Telecommunications Coordination:** Oversee telecommunications development needs for borough-specific and citywide initiatives.
* **Training & Documentation:** Develop protocols, training materials, and best practices for technology initiatives.
* **Document & Knowledge Management:** Support efforts to enhance organizational knowledge-sharing and document management systems.
* **Committee Support:** Actively participate in and support LSNYC’s internal and external committees on technology-related matters.

  

**Q****ualifications & Experience:**

Qualifications include:

* **10+ years of experience** in technology development and management.
* **Hands-on experience in .Net, PHP, SharePoint preferred. At least one required.**
* Experience required on API integration with enterprise level applications.
* Knowledge on MS suite specially EXCEL required. Knowledge on Canva preferred.
* Experience with cloud technologies like AWS and Azure preferred.
* Some experience preferred on co-pilot integration with MS tools and custom apps.
* Ability to learn and adapt with new technology specially in AI and process automation tools.
* Some prior experience with AI is needed.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education in software development/programming.
* Proven track record of implementing technology initiatives that drive organizational improvement.
* Excellent communication, training, and stakeholder management skills.
* Some hands-on configuration and administrative work is needed on applications like Everlaw, Legal server and some custom apps. Training will be provided.

Work Schedule, Salary, and Benefits:

Legal Services NYC is open weekdays. Some evening hours and ability to respond to emergency calls or pages are required. Salary is based on experience and pursuant to a Collective Bargaining Agreement, with excellent benefits and generous leave time.

Salary range based on experience:

* 1-10 years: $68,458- $95,110
* 11-20 years: $97,489 - $119,858
* 21+ years: $121,657 - $130,880

Dependent on work history and experience.

Salary Range

$68,458 - $130,880 USD

All employees are strongly encouraged to continue to receive and maintain up-to-date COVID vaccinations unless they are unable to for medical or religious reasons.

Legal Services NYC is an equal opportunity employer. People of color, women, people with disabilities, people over 40, and gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender people are strongly encouraged to apply.

title: NGM - Capital Project Superintendent
description:
**Position Description:**

Would you like to have a career with a collaborative, diverse, and dynamic mining company? We have an exciting opportunity for you!

Our people division is growing, and we are looking for a Capital Projects Superintendent to join our team. The successful candidate will overshee execution for multiple projects across differnt sites.

At Nevada Gold Mines, our vision is to be the world’s most valued gold mining business by finding, developing, and operating the best assets with the best people. We are committed to a safe work environment sending every person home safe and healthy every day and leaving a sustainable legacy on our host communities.

**Responsibilities:**

* Successfully execute capital projects within existing framework to meet business need
* Evaluate and prioritize prospective projects, including
  + Commission and evaluate trade-off studies
  + Develop project schedules and budgets at appropriate detail
  + Develop and review financial assessments in coordination with Finance partners
  + Ensure projects meet company investment filters
  + Prepare and motivate project approvals
* Support safety culture to execute projects with zero-harm
* Manage consultants, vendors, and contractors to drive project execution
* Direct engineering process to deliver fit for purpose design that meets business need
* Support procurement process, including
  + Coordinate and communicate procurement strategies
  + Develop work scopes and bid packages
  + Complete technical and commercial review
  + Participate in bid clarifications and negotiations
  + Recommend contract award and seek necessary approvals
* Identify, mitigate, monitor, and respond to risks affecting project execution
* Coordinate and communicate with project stakeholders
* Manage capital spend, report variance, and adjust forecasts monthly
* Report project status and risk to stakeholders and senior leadership
* Identify continuous improvement initiatives and develop plans to deliver value savings
* Oversee execution for multiple projects across different sites
* Mentor young and developing project engineers
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Qualifications:**

* B achelor’s degree or relevant experience in engineering or a related field **required**
* Project Management Professional certificate or Professional Engineer licensure **preferred**
* Minimum 10 years’ experience in progressive project management, engineering design, and construction management **preferred**
* Supervisory and leadership experience **preferred**
* Strong understanding of project management techniques **required**
* Technical capability in engineering design **preferred**
* Experience with capital and project management systems **preferred**
* Data and business analysis skills to conduct **preferred**

#LI-JB1

*Thank you for your application, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.*

title: Sales Operations Analyst
description:
Location: Dallas, Texas, United States

**Welcome to the future of cloud networking and security!**

Cato Networks is the first company to converge enterprise networking and security into one centralized and global service that is delivered by cloud. It is led by networking and security pioneer Shlomo Kramer (Check Point, Imperva) and early investor (Palo Alto Networks, Exabeem, Trusteer and more). Cato’s unique technology inspired a brand-new product category, later named “SASE” by Gartner and a market expected to reach $25 billion by 2027.  
  
This is your opportunity to get on the rocket ship and join a company that is building a cutting-edge enterprise network and secure cloud platform, and is on a fast track to becoming the worldwide market leader – don’t miss it!

We are looking for experienced Sales Operations Analyst to join our amazing team. This is an exciting opportunity to work with the company who invented and pioneered the revolution of SASE. You will play a critical role in driving revenue in our defined markets.

The Sales Operations Analyst will play a **pivotal role** in increasing sales representatives’ productivity and will directly contribute to the efficiency of our sales processes. You will be responsible for providing internal support to our Sales Department. This role will work closely with members of Sales, Revenue, Legal and Customer Success departments on a daily basis. The ideal candidate will have experience with SalesForce.com and previously worked at another Software as a Service (SaaS) company. This role requires someone that is well-organized, analytical and an excellent team player, focused on scaling a sales organization and improving performance.

**Role & Responsibilities:**

* Be a part of the global Sales Operations team, working to increase the sales representative’s productivity.
* Assist with deal creation, beginning with the quote and proposal creation through management of the deal cycle.
* Actively engage with multiple business units, gathering input relevant to the deal process.
* Reduce cycle time of a deal from quote creation to execution.
* Training and Enablement of systems and tools.
* Create dashboards and reporting for the sales team and leadership.
* Provide insights from sales data to sales team and leadership.
* Troubleshoot and maintain all sales supporting tools.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* Highly self-motivated with exceptional attention to detail.
* Works well under pressure, with a high degree of adaptability and flexibility in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Strong time management/prioritization skills.
* Strong analytical skills.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint) and strong Excel skills preferred.
* SalesForce.com and CPQ tool experience preferred.
* Must be service oriented and have a great attitude.
* 5+ years of experience in sales operations and/or business systems.
* High-tech company experience (SaaS model and/or start-up company) is an advantage.

#LI-AL1

title: Financial Analyst, Budgets and Business Planning
description:
Overview:

Our team members are the heart of what makes us better.

At **Hackensack Meridian** ***Health*** we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community.

Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change.

The **Financial Analyst, Budgets and Business planning**, is responsible for planning, monitoring, coordinating, collaborating, compiling and analyzing Budget and Business plans for the PSD network as assigned. They will assist in monthly financial information related to assigned areas. Will work closely with Operations, controllers, financial analysts, Administrative Directors, and the Executive Office on various analyses, projections, annual capital, and operating budgets, monthly close as appropriate and applicable. Job responsibilities include all financial aspects of Hackensack Meridian Health's (HMH) goals, which also include all operational matters affecting the preparation and reporting of monthly financial statements, budgeting, internal controls compliance, PeopleSoft general ledger build & maintenance, and oversight on outsourced accounting functions.

Responsibilities:

A day in the life of a **Financial Analyst, Budgets and Business planning** at **Hackensack Meridian** ***Health*** includes:

* Applies GAAP in carrying out core responsibilities of all assigned duties and special projects.
* Consistently and timely communicates with applicable HMH departments leaders and at corporate level regarding all inquiries. Timely prepares and communicates business plans and follows through with the appropriate site controllers and administrators.
* Aid site controllers in justification for the monthly and year-to-date variances and fluctuations (actual-to-budget / actual-to-prior year, or actual to business plan) using statistical, financial, and operational data. Reaches out to the ancillary dept managers in collecting volume variance justifications and compiles the report for the management. This includes focus on the flexed salary and supply variances through application of volume to the variance equations.
* Fully responsible to complete the budgets to selective cost centers from the assigned site.
* Responsible for working with Strategy, business development and operations to develop business plans for new and incremental growth for physician enterprise.
* Extensive analysis on the Missions Support variances working with the Physician Practice team.
* Maintains the upkeep of the Finance quid that are site based to assist the clinical leaders.
* Comprehensive Mission Support Analysis for the assigned site.
* Responsible for review and completion of monthly accruals based on budget expectations. Work with the accounting team to ensure proper recording of standard entries and recoveries .
* Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
* Other duties and/or projects as assigned by the site controller.

Qualifications:

**Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:**

* Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance.
* Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in accounting &/or 3 years of public accounting.
* Demonstrated knowledge and application of GAAP.
* Excellent analytical skills.
* Must be highly computer literate, including advanced use of Excel.
* Must be able to establish effective working relationships with Senior Management and Staff at all levels of the organization.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

**Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:**

* Masters of Business Administration (MBA).
* Familiarity with Google Suite.

**Licenses and Certifications Preferred:**

* Certified Public Accountant (CPA).

If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

Starting Minimum Rate: Starting at $95,555.20 Annually Job Posting Disclosure: **HMH is committed to pay equity and transparency for our team members. The posted rate of pay in this job posting is a reasonable good faith estimate of the minimum base pay for this role at the time of posting in accordance with the New Jersey Pay Transparency Act and does not reflect the full value of our market-competitive total rewards package. The starting rate of pay is provided for informational purposes only and is not a guarantee of a specific offer. Posted hourly rates may be stated as an annual salary in the offer and posted annual salaries may be stated as an hourly rate in the offer, depending on the level and nature of the job duties and credentials of the candidate. The base compensation determined at the time of the offer may be different than the posted rate of pay based on a number of non-discriminatory factors, including but not limited to: Labor Market Data: Compensation is benchmarked against market data to ensure competitiveness. Experience: Years of relevant work experience. Education and Certifications: Level of education attained, including specialized certifications, credentials, completed apprenticeship programs or advanced training. Skills: Demonstrated proficiency in relevant skills and competencies. Geographic Location: Cost of living and market rates for the specific location. Internal Equity: Compensation is determined in a manner consistent with compensation ranges for similar roles within the organization. Budget and Grant Funding: Departmental budgets and any grant funding associated with the job position may impact the pay that can be offered. Some jobs may also be eligible for performance-based incentives, bonuses, or commissions not reflected in the starting rate. Certain positions may also be eligible for shift differentials for work performed on evening, night, or weekend shifts. In addition to our compensation for full-time and part-time (20+ hours/week) job positions, HMH offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, vision, paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and retirement benefits.**

title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SPECIALIST I
description:
Join the Application Development Bureau and play a vital role in shaping the future of criminal justice technology! As part of our team you’ll design, implement, and maintain statewide information systems that directly support law enforcement efforts. We value innovation and collaboration, offering you the chance to work on impactful projects that enhance public safety. Be part of a mission-driven organization where your skills can truly make a difference!

Under the general supervision of the Information Technology Supervisor II. The incumbent performs at the expert specialist level of this career series to analyze, design, develop, and implement the most complex software systems for the Bureau of Firearms (BOF) program. The incumbent will serve as a leader in the development of application functionality and will provide ongoing support to the BOF software systems.

**This position is effective 7/1/2025, pending Governor approval.**  
  
**This is a 12 month limited term position, but may be extended to a maximum of 24 months and/or may become a permanent position based upon operational needs.**

Please let us know how you heard about our position by taking this brief survey:

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/P7X675V

You will find additional information about the job in the **Duty Statement**.

Working Conditions

This position is designated for telework under Government Code section 14200 for eligible applicants residing in California and may require reporting to headquarters or field offices and facilities to fulfill operational needs. All telework schedules are subject to change and may be reevaluated at any time. Telework does not change the terms and conditions of employment, the essential functions of job duties, or required compliance with the Department of Justice policies.  
  
This position is eligible for telework, and will be required to report to the office as needed/required. The successful candidate must reside in California upon appointment.

For current state employees and/or those with reinstatement rights, your salary will be determined in accordance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations.

Established 1/31/18, Pay Letters 18-04 and 18-05

Range A. This range shall apply to persons who do not meet the criteria for Range B or Range C.  
  
Range B. This range shall apply to persons who meet the Minimum Qualifications for the classification and who have also completed two years of satisfactory additional experience performing duties equivalent to or higher than an Information Technology Specialist I.  
  
Range C. This range shall apply to persons who meet the Minimum Qualifications for the classification and who have also completed four years of satisfactory additional experience performing duties equivalent to or higher than an Information Technology Specialist I.:  
  
When the requirements for the criteria are met and upon recommendation of the appointing power, the employee shall receive a rate under the provisions of California Code of Regulations, title 2, section 599.676. Upon movement to Range C, the employee shall receive a rate under the provisions of California Code of Regulations, title 2, section 599.674 shall apply.
