title: Business Systems Analyst III - Pega (remote)
description:
* 29387
* 100 East Tryon Road
* Raleigh, North Carolina; North Carolina, United States
* ROBOTICS & DIG AUTOMATION
* Monday - Friday
* 06/17/2025

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

**Overview**

This is a remote role that may be hired in several markets across the United States.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Pega Business System Analyst to lead and drive business process transformation initiatives using Pega BPM/CRM solutions. This role involves gathering complex business requirements, designing intelligent workflow automation, and ensuring successful Pega implementations. As a senior member of the team, you will collaborate with business stakeholders, architects, and development teams to deliver scalable, high-impact Pega solutions that align with strategic objectives.

  
  
**Responsibilities**  

* Work with senior business stakeholders to identify, analyze, and document complex business processes and requirements.
* Lead and facilitate requirements-gathering sessions, stakeholder workshops, and process reviews.
* Translate business needs into high-quality functional specifications, user stories, process models, and decisioning rules for Pega applications.
* Conduct gap analysis between current and future state processes and recommend automation opportunities.
* Collaborate with Pega Architects and Developers to design and implement robust workflow solutions.
* Define and document case management, workflow automation, business rules, UI/UX configurations, and integration requirements.
* Ensure that business rules and process flows align with Pega best practices and enterprise architecture standards.
* Guide the team in leveraging Pega capabilities such as decisioning, robotics, AI, and low-code automation.
* Act as a strategic advisor to business leaders, driving alignment between business goals and Pega capabilities.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product owners, developers, testers, and solution architects.
* Effectively communicate business and technical concepts to C-suite executives, product managers, and IT teams.
* Lead, mentor, and provide guidance to junior Business Analysts to enhance their Pega expertise.
* Define UAT strategies, test plans, and test scenarios to validate Pega applications.
* Work closely with QA teams to ensure end-to-end testing and issue resolution.
* Ensure business sign-off on Pega solutions before production deployment.
* Support post-implementation reviews and provide recommendations for continuous improvement.
* Analyze existing workflows and propose optimization strategies using Pega’s automation capabilities.
* Stay updated with Pega advancements, new features, and industry trends to recommend innovative solutions.
* Establish and enforce Pega best practices, governance standards, and compliance frameworks.
* Advocate for low-code development, intelligent automation, and digital transformation strategies.

  
**Qualifications**

Bachelor's Degree and 4 years of experience in Systems Support, or Analytics, or Operations Support

OR

High School Diploma or GED and 8 years of experience in Systems Support, or Analytics, or Operations Support

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Minimum 5+ years of experience as a Business System Analyst with a strong focus on Pega BPM/CRM platforms.
* Expertise in Pega PRPC (Process Commander), case management, decisioning, UI configuration, and business rules engine.
* Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments and familiarity with JIRA, Confluence, and DevOps tools.
* Strong understanding of business process modeling (BPMN), data modeling, APIs, and system integration in Pega.
* Knowledge of Pega AI-powered decisioning, robotic process automation (RPA), and workflow orchestration.
* Exposure to SQL queries, data migration, and reporting capabilities within Pega.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to drive data-driven decision-making.
* Excellent verbal and written communication for engaging technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to lead discussions, influence decision-making, and drive consensus.
* Experience in mentoring junior analysts and training business users on Pega functionalities.
* Highly adaptable, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Pega Certified Business Architect (PCBA) or Pega Certified System Architect (PCSA) certification preferred.
* Experience in banking, insurance, healthcare, or financial services industries is a plus.
* Familiarity with AI-driven decisioning, process mining, and advanced analytics in Pega applications.

Creates specifications, project plans, and other documentation in support of business initiatives.

  
**Qualifications**

Bachelor's Degree and 4 years of experience in Project Planning, and Financial Services industry OR High School Diploma or GED and 8 years of experience in Project Planning, and Financial Services industry

Preferred skills:

* Strong analytical skills
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
* Experience running and leading projects
* Experience with Power BI and databases considered a plus

Benefits are an integral part of total rewards and First Citizens Bank is committed to providing a competitive, thoughtfully designed and quality benefits program to meet the needs of our associates.

  

First Citizens Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race (including traits historically associated with race, such as hair texture and protective hairstyles), color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military membership, application, or obligation, or any other legally protected status.  
  
Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act prohibits First Citizens Bank from employing individuals convicted of certain criminal offenses. Offers of employment will be contingent upon a satisfactory background check.  
  
The Bank is committed to maintaining a safe workplace free from the influence of prohibited drugs and the misuse of alcohol and will not tolerate any prohibited drug use or alcohol misuse that jeopardizes the safety of associates, customers or others at the workplace, or threatens the Bank’s operations or competitiveness.

If you have a disability and need special assistance or accommodation to apply for employment at First Citizens Bank, please contact our Human Resources department at 888.716.7199 or email us at hrsc@firstcitizens.com.
company_description: For more than 100 years, Raleigh, N.C. -headquartered First Citizens Bank has helped customers do more with the money they earn, save and invest.

title: Infrastructure Operations Analyst
description:
Be visionary

Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.

We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.

Job Description

Position Summary:

The Infrastructure Operations Analyst supports the operational integrity and financial oversight of IT infrastructure across the organization. This role is responsible for managing vendor relationships, tracking IT contracts and infrastructure assets, coordinating IT purchasing, and collaborating with finance and business units to support annual IT budgeting. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable working across technical and financial domains.

Key Responsibilities:

* Vendor Relationship Management: Maintain strong working relationships with IT vendors to ensure service quality, issue resolution, and alignment with business needs.
* Contract Oversight: Track IT contracts, including costs, renewal dates, and compliance requirements. Ensure timely renewals and alignment with Teledyne standards.
* Infrastructure Inventory & Lifecycle Management: Maintain accurate records of infrastructure assets across the business. Monitor lifecycle status to ensure compliance with Teledyne standards and timely refresh of aging equipment.
* IT Budget Planning & Coordination: Partner with the IT Controller and Teledyne business units to develop and manage annual IT budgets. Provide data-driven insights to support financial planning and forecasting.
* IT Infrastructure Purchasing: Manage the end-to-end purchasing process for IT infrastructure, including gathering requirements, obtaining quotes, placing orders, tracking shipments, and ensuring timely delivery and deployment.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
* 10+ years of experience in IT operations, procurement, or vendor management.
* Familiarity with IT budgeting and financial planning processes.
* Strong organizational, analytical, and communication skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, and IT asset management tools.

Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.

Teledyne is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other characteristic or non-merit based factor made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Sr Business Analyst / Principal Business Analyst - Supply Chain
description:
Join Us as **Sr Business Analyst / Principal Business Analyst** – Supply Chain!

Are you ready to make an impact and drive innovation in our supply chain processes? As a Senior Business Analyst / Principal Business Analyst at Boehringer Ingelheim, you will collaborate with the Human Pharma and Animal Health business units to analyze, maintain, and implement systems and business process changes for our Supply Chain organizations. Your understanding of supply chain processes, particularly in warehouse management, will be key to your success.

Why This Role is Exciting:

* Partner with leading business units to propose and implement innovative solutions.
* Leverage your technical expertise to support and enhance IT processes.
* Engage with a dynamic team and a global community of IT professionals.
Contribute to projects that drive the company's success and efficiency.  

Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence. Your contributions will directly impact our success and help us deliver exceptional products to our patients and customers.

As an employee of Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery, development and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage lie with our people. We support our employees in a number of ways to foster a healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion, mobility, networking and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees.

This role is based in Athens, GA.

**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

* Analyze, enhance and maintain supply chain systems.
* Collaborate across IT, user communities, and solution providers to enhance our IT solutions.
* Provide systems support, perform Life Cycle administrative tasks, and deliver changes to the users.
* Participate in projects and ensure effective interaction with stakeholders.
* Consulting and Analysis: Meet regularly with defined clients and stakeholders to understand and analyze their processes and needs. Determine requirements to present possible solutions or improvements.
* System Support: Perform baseline system support, administrative and maintenance duties for assigned systems. Troubleshoot application and system problems and take corrective actions.
* Project/Solution Activities: Support goals by participating on project teams. Deliver on assigned tasks and action items.
* Technical Focus: Utilize knowledge of applications/systems and underlying architecture in assigned area of responsibility. Develops and maintains awareness of IT process best practices, technology trends and emerging technologies.
Documentation: Produce documentation as required in support of baseline and project activities.

**Requirements**
----------------

**Sr Business Analyst:**

One-plus (1+) years of experience required with a Master’s Degree or two-plus (2+) years of experience required with at least a Bachelor’s Degree.

**Principal Business Analyst:**

Associate degree in Computer Science or MIS or related field with a minimum of 7 years experience; or Bachelor degree in Computer Science, or MIS, or a related field with a minimum of 5 years of experience; or a Master degree in Computer Science, MIS, with minimum 3 year of experience; or relevant Business or IT experience of minimum of 4 years.

* Moderate level of technical understanding and demonstrated knowledge for their area of responsibility.
* Knowledge of project management and experience working on project teams required.
* Experience in working in cross functional team environment
* Moderate level of understanding of system development life cycle methodology in GxP environment
SAP knowledge is a plus  
* **Eligibility Requirements:**

  Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction.

  Must be willing to take a drug test and post-offer physical (if required)

  Must be 18 years of age or older
company_description: Our mission is to create breakthrough therapies that change lives.

title: Business Systems & Reporting Analyst
description:
Overview:

The Business Sysems & Reporting Analyst is a key hands-on role within the Program Management Office, supporting system integrations, internal reporting tools, and ERP implementation & maintenance. This indiidual will work across departments and vendo/partners to ensure that platforms like our ERP and CRM systems are optimized for visibility, performance tracking and usability. The ideal caniddate is analytical, technically curious, and eager to grow their capabilities while bilding real-time dashborads and solving practical business challenges.

Location: Bethesda, MD. In office position.  
Travel: This position does not require travel  
Salary Range:  
Responsibilities:

ERP, CRM, & Systems Support

Partner with system consultants/integrators to support system implementation and configuration.  
Assist in mapping and migrating operational and data (financials, workflows, etc.) between systems.  
Participate in testing, validation, and rollout activities for changes to existing and new enterprise software.

Dashboards & Reporting

Build, update, and maintain dasboards and performance reports using tools such as Smart Suite, Power BI, Excel, or native ERP/CRM reporting tools.  
Collaborate with departments to understand their reporting needs and design visual solutions.  
Ensure reporting accuracy through data validation and collaboration with department stakeholders.

Documentation & Process Alignment

Create SOPs and documentation around system use, data structure, and process workflows.  
Help train internal users and provide support for new platform rollouts or updates.  
Track and escalate system-related issues, proposing practical improvements.

Program Management Support

Contribute to cross-functional initiatives aligned with enterprise system improvements.  
Assist the PMO in tracking progress, milestones, and outcomes related to digital systems.  
Stay current with evolving technologies in business platforms and analytics.  
Qualifications:

Education and Experience

Associate's or Bachelor's degree in business, IT, or a related field.  
1-3 years of experience working in data, reporting, ERP/CRM systems, or similar.  
Exposure to project-based environments, especially system implementations or platform rollouts.

Core Competencies

Technical Aptitude: Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and platforms quickly.  
Data Visualization: experience using Excel, SmartSuite, Power BI, or similar tools.  
Systems Awareness: Basic famiiarity with ERP/CRM platforms (e.g., NetSuite, Salesforce, Zoho).  
Problem Solving: Capable of identifying process or systems gaps and suggesting solutions.  
Communication: Able to translate technical details into clear, user-friendly language.

title: Director, IT Business Analysis
description:
Company Details:

This role will reside within the Data Management and Analytics group of W.R. Berkley with a focus on the Excess & Surplus (E&S Tech) Segment. The ES Tech segment typically writes specialty business often referred to as “non-admitted” insurance utilizing a wholesale-broker. Excess and surplus lines of commercial insurance specialize in underwriting difficult-to-place moderate to high-risk commercial businesses looking for creative solutions to new and unusual complex risks. Lines of business include Commercial Casualty, Professional Liability, and Commercial Property.

Company URL: https://www.berkley.com/

The company is an equal opportunity employer.

Responsibilities:

We are seeking a strategic and results-driven IT Director to lead and manage key technology initiatives within our E&S segment, supporting multiple business priorities. This role will be instrumental in aligning IT capabilities with business goals, driving critical business results, and overseeing both business analysis and quality assurance functions. The ideal candidate will bring a strong mix of technical acumen, leadership, and insurance industry experience.

  

* Collaborate with segment leadership to identify technology opportunities and deliver innovative solutions.
* Serve as a key liaison between IT and business stakeholders, ensuring alignment and transparency.
* Drive elements of the product lifecycle from ideation through delivery and continuous improvement.
* Define and prioritize product roadmaps in collaboration with business and technical teams.
* Oversee a team of Business Analysts responsible for gathering, documenting, and validating business requirements.
* Facilitate workshops, interviews, and other techniques to elicit clear and actionable requirements.
* Ensure traceability of requirements through development, testing, and deployment.
* Lead the Quality Assurance team to ensure robust testing strategies and high-quality deliverables.
* Implement and maintain QA best practices, including test planning, automation, and defect tracking.
* Champion a culture of continuous improvement and proactive risk mitigation.
* Mentor and develop a high-performing team of analysts and QA professionals.
* Foster a collaborative, inclusive, and agile work environment.
* Manage resource allocation, performance reviews, and professional development plans.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, Business, or related field, or equivalent experience. Master’s degree preferred.
* 10+ years of progressive IT experience, including 5+ years in a leadership role.
* Proven experience in product management and business analysis within the insurance or financial services industry.
* Demonstrated success in leading cross-functional teams and managing complex projects.
* Experience with Agile methodologies and tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence).
* Familiarity with modern QA practices, including test automation frameworks.
* Strong understanding of E&S insurance operations.

Additional Company Details: We do not accept any unsolicited resumes from external recruiting agencies or firms. The company offers a competitive compensation plan and robust benefits package for full time regular employees. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Sponsorship Details: Sponsorship not Offered for this Role
company_description: Headquartered in Greenwich, Connecticut, W. R. Berkley Corporation, a Fortune 500 company, is a financial services and insurance firm that has both individual and corporate customers.

title: Operations Analyst
description:
Overview:

Provides operational and financial support across multiple Nursing units in order to achieve and maximize unit efficiency; work with nursing leaders to plan, strategize and coordinate the health services across several units. Acts as a liaison to other departments for the implementation of new projects, creates reports to analyze operational effectiveness, works to reach financial goals and maintains budgets.

Come join a remarkable team where quality care meets quality service, in every dimension, every time.

**#JoinTeamAubergine #NovantHealth** Let Novant Health be the destination for your professional growth.

At Novant Health, one of our core values is diversity and inclusion. By engaging the strengths and talents of each team member, we ensure a strong organization capable of providing remarkable healthcare to our patients, families and communities. Therefore, we invite applicants from all group dynamics to apply to our exciting career opportunities.

* **Education:** Bachelors degree in business or health care administration, finance, accounting or other related area, required.
* **Experience:** Minimum of three years business experience, required. Healthcare experience, preferred.

Due to the intense paper work and staff interaction, it is important to have strong verbal and written communications skills. Must be able to work well with a variety of professionals, as well as able to work independently with minimal direct supervision. Analytical and problem solving skills and attention to detail required. Strong computer skills necessary. Must be able to secure and maintain private and confidential information.

Responsibilities:

It is the responsibility of every Novant Health team member to deliver the most remarkable patient experience in every dimension, every time.

* Our team members are part of an environment that fosters team work, team member engagement and community involvement.
* The successful team member has a commitment to leveraging diversity and inclusion in support of quality care.
* All Novant Health team members are responsible for fostering a safe patient environment driven by the principles of "First Do No Harm".

title: Partner+ Business Analyst
description:
As the **Partner+ Business Analyst**, you’ll optimize programs with existing partners to ensure we are positioned well operationally for new vendor adoption. You will be the subject matter expert supporting brands assigned to your purview. You will work closely with internal and external partners to successfully launch and grow prioritized opportunities. This role requires individuals to be familiar across ecommerce best practices and supporting capabilities (ex. supply chain, order management) to identify and drive growth across a variety of assigned initiatives. To be successful in this role, you will think strategically while being able to execute on tactical operational & business improvements.  
  
This role is hybrid, which means you will be required to work some days on-site at the Best Buy location listed on this posting and some days virtually from home or other non-Best Buy location. The specific work arrangements vary by role and team. The recruiter or hiring manager will provide more details during the hiring process.  
  
**What you’ll do**

* Drive adoption of Partner+ through continuing to maintain a pipeline of interested vendors, actively pitching/negotiation terms, and facilitating onboarding
* Monitor Partner+ orders/integrations to ensure all are functioning as expected, actively triage any identified issues with vendors and supporting bby.com cross-functional partners (OPS/DAT/Retail/OM/etc)
* Partner with technology teams to maintain roadmap of enhancements to continually grow the Partner+ program and expand capabilities/services offered to vendor partners
* Support run the business and growth opportunities for assigned brands within the platform through clear communication and data driven story telling
* Articulate e-Commerce business metrics to budget and yearly overviews (financials, operational metrics, catalog opportunities and status, key category specific promotional and launch event impact, etc), driving recommendations to achieve business goals
* Identify and track key operational KPIs to optimize processes, and drive efficiencies leveraging systems/technology to reduce labor needs and drive increased scalability
* Effectively partner cross-functionally across technology, operations, supply chain, legal, accounting, finance, and retail in support of growing partners

**Basic qualifications**

* 1+ years of experience in merchandise planning, site merchandising, demand planning, supply chain or related business teams
* 1+ years of experience communicating and partnering with vendors/3rd party
* 1+ years of experience performing data analysis
* Beginner level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel

**Preferred qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree
* Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite

**What’s in it for you**  
We’re committed to helping our people thrive at work and at home. We offer generous benefits that address your total well-being and provide support as you need it, especially key moments in your life.  
Our benefits include:

* Competitive pay
* Generous employee discount
* Financial savings and retirement resources
* Support for your physical and mental well-being

**About us**  
As part of the Best Buy team, you’ll help us fulfill our purpose to enrich lives through technology. We bring that to life every day by humanizing and personalizing tech solutions for every stage of life — in our stores, online and in customers’ homes.  
Our culture is built on deeply supporting and valuing our amazing employees who make it all possible. We’re committed to being a great place to work, where you can unlock unique career possibilities. Above all, we aim to provide a place where you can bring your full, authentic self to work now and into the future. Tomorrow works here.™  
  
Best Buy is an equal opportunity employer.

Position Type: Full time
company_description: Best Buy is a leading provider of technology products, services and solutions.

title: Operations Research Analyst
description:
Overview:

Astrion is seeking a **Task Order Project Manager** to lead and oversee task orders supporting mission-critical operations. Responsible for cost, schedule, and performance. Serves as the primary point of contact for the government on all task order matters. Location is at the Pentagon.

  

* Supports the Program Manager and is the single point of contact to manage all programmatic matters of task orders and is responsible for managing the day-to-day operation of the task order.
* Experience in a supervisory capacity in planning, developing, and executing major research, engineering, and development efforts for defense organizations.
* Experience in establishing strong working relationships with R&D program managers as well as organization leadership; tracking task order efforts to rapidly identify and resolve potential and new problems; and identifying and resolving administrative and contractual issues related to a support services contract is required.
* Demonstrated creativity, foresight, initiative, and mature judgment in anticipating and solving unprecedented problems.
* Experience interfacing with Joint Staff, Services, and warfighters to coordinate engineering and analysis needs and analytic results is highly desired.

**Requirements:**

  

* A minimum of 15 years of experience
* Bachelor's Degree
* Clearance: TS/SCI

title: Business Interlock Manager
description:
The **Business Interlock Manager** role will shape the evolution of learning strategy, design next-gen capability development ecosystems, and drive meaningful transformation across our enterprise. In this pivotal leadership role, you will partner directly with clients and cross-functional teams to reimagine how learning fuels business strategy in an AI-powered world.

You won’t just create learning programs—you’ll engineer the future of capability enablement, infusing it with GenAI, immersive tech, real-time skills intelligence, and adaptive frameworks to power workforce transformation at scale.

**Your Impact**

As the **Business Interlock****Manager**, you'll serve as the strategic architect and experience designer for learning interventions that enable rapid upskilling, behavior change, and long-term growth. You’ll operate as both thought leader and execution partner, guiding Learning Studio teams to deliver bold, measurable outcomes across a dynamic development pipeline of Academies, solutions, and enterprise programs.

This is a high-influence, high-visibility role for a leader who is equal parts visionary, builder, and operator.

**What You’ll Lead**

**Learning Strategy**

* Develop future-fit learning strategies grounded in business priorities, workforce trends, and the evolving skills landscape.
* Design learning pathways that guide learners across proficiency levels, supported by modern frameworks, digital ecosystems, and on-demand technologies.
* Leverage tools like talent intelligence platforms, AI-enabled L&D diagnostics, and predictive workforce planning to shape learning roadmaps.

**Curriculum Innovation, Planning & Solutioning**

* Proactively engage with business stakeholders to understand strategic priorities, pain points, and emerging capability needs.
* Translate business drivers into bold learning solutions by recommending the most impactful learning architectures, modalities, and experiences.
* Curate and integrate learning assets from internal and external sources to build dynamic, role-based learning ecosystems.
* Develop and document solution requirements via Preliminary Learning Briefs (PLBs) or executive-ready summary decks.
* Review and map source content to skill frameworks and performance goals—identifying gaps and opportunities for innovation.
* Define and iterate on initial scope, budget, and resource models, leveraging data to optimize speed, scale, and impact while closing skill gaps, enabling business agility, and empowering people to grow.
* Generate and negotiate multiple solution pathways, tailoring the approach to learner needs, tech readiness, and business goals.

* Craft transformative learning solutions that blend storytelling, science, and smart technology (e.g., VR, adaptive learning, scenario-based simulations).
* Maintain curriculum relevance through continuous content optimization, performance data insights, and learner feedback loops.

**Strategic Demand & Pipeline Planning**

* Partner with clients and business sponsors to map out 30/60/90-day learning demand, scope, and timelines with agility and foresight.
* Manage resource allocations and staffing projections, ensuring the right capabilities are in place to deliver at speed and scale.
* Continuously assess the development pipeline, balancing capacity with innovation potential.

**Stakeholder Influence & Advisory**

* Act as a trusted advisor and strategic partner, helping stakeholders navigate complexity and align learning with organizational outcomes.
* Guide clients through the design-to-deploy journey, building consensus, addressing friction points, and unlocking new value.
* Use data storytelling to enable decision-making, highlight performance trends, and advocate for ongoing investment in learning.

**Operational Excellence**

* Partner with the Learning Studio Lead on goals, deliverables, timelines and dependencies to execute projects (e.g. staffing, onboarding, team engagement) across the full lifecycle—design, build, deploy, measure.
* Define KPIs tied to business outcomes and develop robust evaluation frameworks that assess learning impact using behavioral, qualitative, and quantitative data.
* Champion lean operating models that emphasize continuous improvement, reusability, and intelligent automation.

**What You Bring**

* **Strategic Intelligence**: You see the bigger picture and understand how learning drives transformation, not just training.
* **Digital Fluency**: You're fluent in the tools, tech, and trends (GenAI, LLMs, VR, nudging, microlearning) shaping the future of work and learning.
* **Programmatic Agility**: You can scale from executive vision to executional precision with a sharp eye on time, budget, and quality.
* **Human-Centered Thinking**: You put learners at the center, designing for relevance, accessibility, and behavioral impact.

  

**Basic Qualifications**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in Learning Advisory
* Minimum of 5 years in Program Design

**Preferred:**

* Experience with AI in learning, immersive tech, or enterprise learning systems
* Bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design, Learning Sciences, Organizational Psychology, or a related field (Master’s preferred)
* Exposure to learning analytics, behavior change theory, and adaptive learning technologies
* Strong track record leading cross-functional teams and managing large-scale learning portfolios
* Deep understanding of learning ecosystems, digital platforms, and measurement methodologies
* Familiarity with accessibility best practices and inclusive design
* Excellent communicator and relationship-builder across all levels

***Requesting An Accommodation***

Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.*

Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.*

* Partner with the Learning Studio Lead on goals, deliverables, timelines and dependencies to execute projects (e.g. staffing, onboarding, team engagement) across the full lifecycle—design, build, deploy, measure.
* Define KPIs tied to business outcomes and develop robust evaluation frameworks that assess learning impact using behavioral, qualitative, and quantitative data.
* Champion lean operating models that emphasize continuous improvement, reusability, and intelligent automation.

**What You Bring**

* **Strategic Intelligence**: You see the bigger picture and understand how learning drives transformation, not just training.
* **Digital Fluency**: You're fluent in the tools, tech, and trends (GenAI, LLMs, VR, nudging, microlearning) shaping the future of work and learning.
* **Programmatic Agility**: You can scale from executive vision to executional precision with a sharp eye on time, budget, and quality.
* **Human-Centered Thinking**: You put learners at the center, designing for relevance, accessibility, and behavioral impact.

  

**Basic Qualifications**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in Learning Advisory
* Minimum of 5 years in Program Design

**Preferred:**

* Experience with AI in learning, immersive tech, or enterprise learning systems
* Bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design, Learning Sciences, Organizational Psychology, or a related field (Master’s preferred)
* Exposure to learning analytics, behavior change theory, and adaptive learning technologies
* Strong track record leading cross-functional teams and managing large-scale learning portfolios
* Deep understanding of learning ecosystems, digital platforms, and measurement methodologies
* Familiarity with accessibility best practices and inclusive design
* Excellent communicator and relationship-builder across all levels

title: Business Interlock Manager
description:
The **Business Interlock Manager** role will shape the evolution of learning strategy, design next-gen capability development ecosystems, and drive meaningful transformation across our enterprise. In this pivotal leadership role, you will partner directly with clients and cross-functional teams to reimagine how learning fuels business strategy in an AI-powered world.

You won’t just create learning programs—you’ll engineer the future of capability enablement, infusing it with GenAI, immersive tech, real-time skills intelligence, and adaptive frameworks to power workforce transformation at scale.

**Your Impact**

As the **Business Interlock****Manager**, you'll serve as the strategic architect and experience designer for learning interventions that enable rapid upskilling, behavior change, and long-term growth. You’ll operate as both thought leader and execution partner, guiding Learning Studio teams to deliver bold, measurable outcomes across a dynamic development pipeline of Academies, solutions, and enterprise programs.

This is a high-influence, high-visibility role for a leader who is equal parts visionary, builder, and operator.

**What You’ll Lead**

**Learning Strategy**

* Develop future-fit learning strategies grounded in business priorities, workforce trends, and the evolving skills landscape.
* Design learning pathways that guide learners across proficiency levels, supported by modern frameworks, digital ecosystems, and on-demand technologies.
* Leverage tools like talent intelligence platforms, AI-enabled L&D diagnostics, and predictive workforce planning to shape learning roadmaps.

**Curriculum Innovation, Planning & Solutioning**

* Proactively engage with business stakeholders to understand strategic priorities, pain points, and emerging capability needs.
* Translate business drivers into bold learning solutions by recommending the most impactful learning architectures, modalities, and experiences.
* Curate and integrate learning assets from internal and external sources to build dynamic, role-based learning ecosystems.
* Develop and document solution requirements via Preliminary Learning Briefs (PLBs) or executive-ready summary decks.
* Review and map source content to skill frameworks and performance goals—identifying gaps and opportunities for innovation.
* Define and iterate on initial scope, budget, and resource models, leveraging data to optimize speed, scale, and impact while closing skill gaps, enabling business agility, and empowering people to grow.
* Generate and negotiate multiple solution pathways, tailoring the approach to learner needs, tech readiness, and business goals.

* Craft transformative learning solutions that blend storytelling, science, and smart technology (e.g., VR, adaptive learning, scenario-based simulations).
* Maintain curriculum relevance through continuous content optimization, performance data insights, and learner feedback loops.

**Strategic Demand & Pipeline Planning**

* Partner with clients and business sponsors to map out 30/60/90-day learning demand, scope, and timelines with agility and foresight.
* Manage resource allocations and staffing projections, ensuring the right capabilities are in place to deliver at speed and scale.
* Continuously assess the development pipeline, balancing capacity with innovation potential.

**Stakeholder Influence & Advisory**

* Act as a trusted advisor and strategic partner, helping stakeholders navigate complexity and align learning with organizational outcomes.
* Guide clients through the design-to-deploy journey, building consensus, addressing friction points, and unlocking new value.
* Use data storytelling to enable decision-making, highlight performance trends, and advocate for ongoing investment in learning.

**Operational Excellence**

* Partner with the Learning Studio Lead on goals, deliverables, timelines and dependencies to execute projects (e.g. staffing, onboarding, team engagement) across the full lifecycle—design, build, deploy, measure.
* Define KPIs tied to business outcomes and develop robust evaluation frameworks that assess learning impact using behavioral, qualitative, and quantitative data.
* Champion lean operating models that emphasize continuous improvement, reusability, and intelligent automation.

**What You Bring**

* **Strategic Intelligence**: You see the bigger picture and understand how learning drives transformation, not just training.
* **Digital Fluency**: You're fluent in the tools, tech, and trends (GenAI, LLMs, VR, nudging, microlearning) shaping the future of work and learning.
* **Programmatic Agility**: You can scale from executive vision to executional precision with a sharp eye on time, budget, and quality.
* **Human-Centered Thinking**: You put learners at the center, designing for relevance, accessibility, and behavioral impact.

  

**Basic Qualifications**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in Learning Advisory
* Minimum of 5 years in Program Design

**Preferred:**

* Experience with AI in learning, immersive tech, or enterprise learning systems
* Bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design, Learning Sciences, Organizational Psychology, or a related field (Master’s preferred)
* Exposure to learning analytics, behavior change theory, and adaptive learning technologies
* Strong track record leading cross-functional teams and managing large-scale learning portfolios
* Deep understanding of learning ecosystems, digital platforms, and measurement methodologies
* Familiarity with accessibility best practices and inclusive design
* Excellent communicator and relationship-builder across all levels

title: Senior Analyst (Accounting and Controls) - Business and Finance
description:
This position consists of various monthly duties, assistance with financial system implementations, report writing, security access, and the design and performance of internal audits on various business processes to ensure financial systems are operating as designed.

**Primary Duties:**

* Business process review, documentation, and design. This includes the required maintenance of business processes within Workday (Finance ERP).
* Manage special projects for the Business & Finance Office.
* Report writing within Workday (Finance ERP).
* Assist with business process reviews/internal control audits and recommend improvements to those processes.
* Prepare monthly bank reconciliations for all University bank accounts.
* Reconcile other key balance sheet accounts monthly.
* Maintain security, access, and approval levels.
* Perform other duties as required/assigned by leadership.

**Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Bachelor’s degree with major in accounting or other closely related degree.
* Minimum five (5) years of professional experience related to direct accounting operations.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with students, faculty and staff.
* Ability to effectively summarize and present information.
* Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to complete projects on a timely basis and manage multiple priorities.
* Experience with account reconciliations.
* Experience with general ledger accounting and journal entries.
* Experience with Microsoft Excel and Access.

**Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Master’s degree in related field.
* Eight (8) years of professional experience related to direct accounting operations.
* Experience with modifying/designing financial ERP systems.
* Experience with Workday (Finance ERP), especially in reporting writing and business process design.
* Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) or Certified Public Accountant (CPA).

**Working Conditions:** Normal office environment. Some travel may be required.

**Salary & Benefits:** M inimum starting $65,000; commensurate with experience and preferred qualifications being met.

* Comprehensive benefits package including medical, vision, dental, life insurance, generous employer retirement contributions, wellness resources and tuition waiver effective on date of hire.

**How to Apply:** Attach your cover letter and resume. The system will allow you to attach these documents electronically. If you have questions about the position or the posting, please contact search chair Karen Mushong, mushongk@gvsu.edu. If you need technical assistance , please contact Human Resources at hro@gvsu.edu .

*Please note that successful applicants are responsible for ensuring their eligibility to work in the United States (i.e. a citizen or national of the United States, a lawful permanent resident, a foreign national authorized to work in the United States without the need of an employer sponsorship) on or before the effective date of appointment.*

**Application Deadline:** Application review begins June 30, 2025 . This posting may be closed at any time at the discretion of the University.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Must have the physical stamina to work long hours and/or more than 5 days per week. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The information contained in this job description is for compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act as amended by the ADA Amendment Act (2008), Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, and other applicable federal and state laws that prohibit discrimination on the basis of disability. GVSU will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities upon request. See www.gvsu.edu/equalopportunity/. TDD Callers: Call Michigan Relay Center at 711 (in State) or 1-800-833-7833 (out of State).

Grand Valley State University is an Antidiscrimination/Equal Opportunity Employer, which includes providing equal opportunity for racial and ethnic minorities, women, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities. University policy extends protections to additional identities.

title: Solution Architect
description:
Here at Pearson Virtual Schools (PVS) we are creating a powerful, yet intuitive virtual K-12 experience that expands the ways in which children can learn, while igniting their passions and helping them gain the life skills they need to thrive in the modern world. We are growing and we want you to be a part of our bright future!

At its core, the Solution Architect’s role is to collaborate with key stakeholders and engineering teams to evaluate business requirements and design solutions using elements of business process, information, and technology which when combined, enhance the platform or solve a specific problem, all while adhering to enterprise architecture standards. Solution Architects define solutions which meet agreed upon business requirements by understanding technical components and parameters, identifying applications and interfaces, and documenting these part-pieces of solutions, building detailed design documents and diagrams that pull it all together.

The Solution Architect is not only responsible for finding answers and designing solutions, but they are also empowered to actively lead a technical vision from concept to completion. They act as a bridge between leadership, key stakeholders, and technical teams, and communicate their solutions in both technical and non-technical terms.

To round out the bridge; Technical knowledge, an ability to communicate, strong collaboration skills, solid teamwork and agility are all key attributes of a Solution Architect.

**Core Tasks and Responsibilities**

* Participate in collaboration efforts around new projects and provide thought leadership and technological suggestions to achieve the desired goal
* Create high-level solution-approach documents that outline the proposed solutions, technology components, estimated costs, proposed resources, and estimated resource usage
* Create low-level solution designs which includes any necessary components, technology sequencing, and master end-to-end plan
* Have working knowledge of and ability to use common Generative AI tools in your daily workflow
* Partner with all levels of the organization including Product / Business stakeholders, Engineering / DevOps, Agile Facilitation, Management, and Production Support / Site Reliability Engineering in the development of end-to-end solutions
* Account for challenges generated by constraints including risks, time, resources and scope
* Partner with Agile Facilitation and Product Management teams to provide key insights and progress into the status of solution development
* Provide frequent reviews of in-flight solutions to stakeholders, management, and leadership and be prepared to speak to them in both technical and high-level terms
* Work closely with Software Engineering leadership and contributors to ensure delivery of quality solutions
* Collaborate with Enterprise Architecture and Site Reliability Engineering teams to ensure proper technology selections, infrastructure design, and cloud resource allocations

**Technical Background & Skillsets**

* Master's degree in computer science / software engineering or equivalent professional experience
* Project management and leadership skills are essential
* Experience developing IT and cloud infrastructure
* Current understanding of best practices around data protection and security
* Experience in software engineering and design architecture
* Experience developing, designing, and/or leading teams developing web-based applications
* Understanding and usage of Generative AI tools to accelerate workflows to deliver software faster
* Advanced understanding of business analysis techniques and processes
* Professional experience working with and analyzing infrastructure and software
* Advanced knowledge of Learning Management Systems (LMS), Educational Management Systems, or Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems is desirable
* Analytical Skills - Strong ability to use critical thinking and reasoning to solve a problem
* Excellent verbal, written, and communication skills
* Positive outlook in meeting challenges and working to a high level
* Ability to “connect the dots” when it comes to large system design and understands, communicates, and solves for enterprise scale technical integration concerns
* Evidence of negotiation skills, problem-solving, planning skills, and good judgment
* Demonstrated experience to adapt to changing priorities
* Ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to balance strategic thinking/long term opportunities with operational focus
* 10+ more years of combined software development and architecture experience
* 5+ years of experience with .NET (Framework and Core) development with a focus on web-related frameworks is desirable
* 5+ years of experience with cloud computing. AWS experience is highly desired
* 4-5 years' experience in analyzing business requirements, recommending technical solutions, and writing technical specifications and/or requirements

Solution Architects define solutions which meet agreed upon business requirements by understanding technical components and parameters, identifying applications and interfaces, and documenting these part-pieces of solutions, building detailed design documents and diagrams that pull it all together.

The Solution Architect is not only responsible for finding answers and designing solutions, but they are also empowered to actively lead a technical vision from concept to completion. They act as a bridge between leadership, key stakeholders, and technical teams, and communicate their solutions in both technical and non-technical terms.

To round out the bridge; Technical knowledge, an ability to communicate, strong collaboration skills, solid teamwork and agility are all key attributes of a Solution Architect.

**Core Tasks and Responsibilities**

* Participate in collaboration efforts around new projects and provide thought leadership and technological suggestions to achieve the desired goal
* Create high-level solution-approach documents that outline the proposed solutions, technology components, estimated costs, proposed resources, and estimated resource usage
* Create low-level solution designs which includes any necessary components, technology sequencing, and master end-to-end plan
* Have working knowledge of and ability to use common Generative AI tools in your daily workflow
* Partner with all levels of the organization including Product / Business stakeholders, Engineering / DevOps, Agile Facilitation, Management, and Production Support / Site Reliability Engineering in the development of end-to-end solutions
* Account for challenges generated by constraints including risks, time, resources and scope
* Partner with Agile Facilitation and Product Management teams to provide key insights and progress into the status of solution development
* Provide frequent reviews of in-flight solutions to stakeholders, management, and leadership and be prepared to speak to them in both technical and high-level terms
* Work closely with Software Engineering leadership and contributors to ensure delivery of quality solutions
* Collaborate with Enterprise Architecture and Site Reliability Engineering teams to ensure proper technology selections, infrastructure design, and cloud resource allocations

**Technical Background & Skillsets**

* Master's degree in computer science / software engineering or equivalent professional experience
* Project management and leadership skills are essential
* Experience developing IT and cloud infrastructure
* Current understanding of best practices around data protection and security
* Experience in software engineering and design architecture
* Experience developing, designing, and/or leading teams developing web-based applications
* Understanding and usage of Generative AI tools to accelerate workflows to deliver software faster
* Advanced understanding of business analysis techniques and processes
* Professional experience working with and analyzing infrastructure and software
* Advanced knowledge of Learning Management Systems (LMS), Educational Management Systems, or Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems is desirable
* Analytical Skills - Strong ability to use critical thinking and reasoning to solve a problem
* Excellent verbal, written, and communication skills
* Positive outlook in meeting challenges and working to a high level
* Ability to “connect the dots” when it comes to large system design and understands, communicates, and solves for enterprise scale technical integration concerns
* Evidence of negotiation skills, problem-solving, planning skills, and good judgment
* Demonstrated experience to adapt to changing priorities
* Ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to balance strategic thinking/long term opportunities with operational focus
* 10+ more years of combined software development and architecture experience
* 5+ years of experience with .NET (Framework and Core) development with a focus on web-related frameworks is desirable
* 5+ years of experience with cloud computing. AWS experience is highly desired
* 4-5 years' experience in analyzing business requirements, recommending technical solutions, and writing technical specifications and/or requirements

title: Sr Business Process Analyst
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Business Process Analyst to join our dynamic PSA team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, technical proficiency, and the ability to translate complex business requirements into effective technical solutions. This role is crucial in ensuring that our business systems align with our strategic goals and operational needs.

**What's in it for me**

* Impact the success of our innovative projects and help define the future of our offerings.
* Our collaborative environment fosters innovation while providing the support and security you need to thrive.

**What You Will Do:**

* Responsible for understanding the technology, business processes and opportunities in the context of the technical and business requirements and recommends solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. This includes working as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate, document and validate requirements for changes to business processes, revising existing system logic difficulties as necessary, policies and information systems as well as ensuring testing requirements are met and documenting business requirements.
* Passionately drives applications to deliver customer value and demonstrates a high-level of ownership and accountability
* Leads IoT projects/initiatives to deliver highly secure solutions with operational excellence
* Clearly articulates and documents business requirements
* Leverage Azure DevOps to create features and user stories (with acceptance criteria) to deliver the capability
* Assesses the risks of various solutions and prioritizes competing business demands
* Manages ongoing relationship with business partner to drive satisfaction with various stakeholders
* Coordinates project delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions
* Engages in user testing, pilot testing, and project launches
* Monitors and tracks the success/value delivered metrics around projects and platforms
* Obtains key inputs from architecture leads and identifies solution interdependencies
* Engages with the business and various users to incorporate usability and user interface needs when designing solutions
* Manages and leads high-level project plans and communicates status updates to stakeholders
* Provide platform management and leadership for mature applications
* Leverages ideas, suggestions, and innovations in ways that make them leverageable across all business units
* Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree
* 12 years’ work experience in an analytical and problem-solving role
* 12 years’ experience in a business analysis role
* 6 years’ experience in IoT and/or industrial controls
* 6 years’ experience in an iOS app business analysis role
* Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
* Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
* Experience generating process documentation
* No immigration sponsorship available for this position

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Chemistry, or Marketing
* 5 years’ experience in project management
* Previous experience in Business/Systems Analysis or Technical background with an equipment with embedded software
* Experience in leading software applications that deliver and communicate value to customers, using metrics to clearly quantify the impact
* Proven ability to resolve problems independently and take appropriate action in a timely and professional manner

**Annual or Hourly Compensation Range**

The pay range for this position is $83,600.00 - $125,400.00. Many factors are taken into consideration when determining compensation, such as experience, education, training, geography, etc. We comply with all minimum wage and overtime laws.

**Benefits**

Ecolab strives to provide comprehensive and market-competitive benefits to meet the needs of our associates and their families.

*If you are viewing this posting on a site other than our Ecolab Career website, view our benefits at* *jobs.ecolab.com/working-here.*

**Potential Customer Requirements Notice**

To meet customer requirements and comply with local or state regulations, applicants for certain customer-facing roles may need to:

* Undergo additional background screens and/or drug/alcohol testing for customer credentialing.
* Be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, including a booster if eligible, unless a religious or medical accommodation is requested by the applicant and approved by Ecolab.

**Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)**

Ecolab will provide reasonable accommodation (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with our application process upon request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require accommodation assistance in this application process, please visit the Recruiting Support link in the footer of each page of our career website.

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**  
At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.

In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York City Fair Chance Act.

title: Operations Analyst (PST Hours)
description:
POSITION SUMMARY
  
  
We are seeking an Operations Analyst to join our Local Operations team. In this role, you will provide critical analytical and operational support to our leadership team, including the Senior Director and Vice President of Operations. You will play a key role in developing and optimizing processes to drive operational improvements, conducting data analysis, identifying trends, and creating supporting materials for executive report-outs. Working closely with the Vice President, you will assess operational objectives, evaluate performance metrics, and identify opportunities to streamline processes. You’ll be a great fit if your strengths include advanced analytical skills, attention to detail, and a passion for healthcare operations.
  
  
WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO
  
  
Radiology Partners, through its owned and affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, our mission is to transform radiology by innovating across clinical value, technology, service, and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
  
  
**WHY RADIOLOGY PARTNERS AND/OR DEPARTMENT:**  

* Competitive Benefits package - Eligibility starts the month after hire, with tiered options to choose from.
* Compensation Reviews, Career Growth Opportunities
* Generous PTO Plans and Paid Holidays
* Proudly Certified as a Great Place to Work for Five Consecutive Years

POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  

* Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for process improvements. Create reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and assist with decision-making. Use Excel, Smartsheet, and other tools to organize and manipulate data, applying advanced formulas and functions to synthesize detailed findings into actionable insights and recommendations.
* Strategic Thinking & Problem Solving: Contribute to strategic planning discussions, offering analytical insights that inform decision-making. Take ownership of key projects and manage deliverables to meet deadlines.
* Process Improvement: Assist in the development and optimization of operational processes. Support the operating team in identifying inefficiencies and recommending solutions to enhance operational effectiveness.
* Collaboration with Stakeholders: Work closely with operations managers, directors, and other cross-functional teams to support business goals. Assist in the implementation of strategic initiatives that enhance client satisfaction and improve operational performance.
* Documentation & Reporting: Assist in creating and maintaining detailed documentation for operational processes and project progress. Ensure accurate tracking of key metrics and outcomes.

DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
  

* Bachelor’s degree required
* 0-3 years’ experience in the healthcare, investment banking, consulting, or corporate development field or in a related function highly preferred
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Advanced Excel and Smartsheet (reporting expertise), PowerPoint, and Tableau skills
* Healthcare, Financial, Accounting or Quantitative background is a plus
* Experience working collaboratively across multiple functions (Operations/Finance/IT/Rev Cycle/HR/Analytics/Clinical) a plus
* Highly motivated self-starter who is an excellent team player

**COMPENSATION:**  
The salary range for this position is $60,000-$70,000. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, geographic location etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus.
  
  
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
  
  
**CCPA Notice:** When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History.
  
  
Radiology Partners participates in [1] E-verify.
  
  
**Beware of Fraudulent Messages:**  
Radiology Partners will never request payment, banking or other financial information in exchange for interviews or as part of the hiring process. Additionally, we will not send checks for deposit into your bank account at any stage of recruitment. All communication during the interview and hiring process should come from an email address ending in "@radpartners.com." If you suspect you are receiving a fraudulent job offer or solicitation from Radiology Partners or one of our local practices, please email [2] talent@radpartners.com to notify our team.
  
  
References
  
  
Visible links

**2. mailto:** talent@radpartners.com
