title: Institutional Sales Analyst
description:
Business Unit:

North America Institutional

Salary Range:

$78,000 USD - $90,000 USD

Specific compensation will be based on candidate’s experience, skills, qualifications, commercial considerations, and other job-related factors permitted by law. At Russell Investments, salary is just one part of our compensation package. Our total rewards approach includes an annual performance bonus (subject to eligibility criteria) in addition to participation in our competitive benefits programs including healthcare, retirement, vacation, and wellbeing programs.

Job Description:

The purpose of this position is to provide sales and analytical support to an assigned set of senior institutional sales professionals. The Sales Analyst supports the growth of Russell Investments Institutional Business by drafting, reviewing, and finalizing sales presentations for external use, performing investment analysis, providing market research, and acting to coordinate internal and external resources during sales engagements. This role is expected to enhance the productivity and success of the sales team by collecting and interpreting data, prioritizing tasks and producing high quality deliverables for consumption by sales team members, clients and prospects.

The responsibilities of the individual in this position include:

* Provides front line on-demand sales team member support. Identifies and prioritizes critical requests and needs. Partners with senior team members (Sales Management, Regional Directors, and Associate Regional Directors) as a resource to enhance client interactions via presentation creation, investment analysis, meeting and logistic support, and territory-level CRM database cleanup and maintenance.
* Portfolio performance data collection, asset allocation, fund and solution pricing support, and other investment solution related tasks as required.
* Creation of client and prospect specific output using provided sales tools with particular attention to deadlines and detail. Researching meeting attendees, open opportunities, meeting notes and other general meeting preparation.
* Coordination of compliance approval process for all relevant deliverables, ownership of quarterly and monthly reporting items, and deliver on requests for client onboarding support.

The successful candidate will have extensive demonstrable skills and experiences including the following:

* B.A. degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related field
* At least two years of relevant experience with demonstrated knowledge of financial markets, investment industry, investment products, or other related financial area
* Ability to conduct and present thorough research on potential clients, competitors and other sales process stakeholders
* Demonstrated client relationship ability
* Credible and confident with the ability to communicate with stakeholders
* Ability to execution on time, under pressure, and with quality on different projects simultaneously
* Proven analytical, technical, and systems skills
* Self-starter and able to demonstrate initiative

*This role is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsorship. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States without employer sponsorship, now or in the future.*

Equal Employment Opportunity

Russell Investments is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all associates and employment applicants regardless of race, religion, ancestry, creed, color, gender (including gender identity which refers to a person's actual or perceived sex, and includes self-image, appearance, behavior or expression, whether or not different from that traditionally associated with a person's biological sex), age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, past or present unemployment status , or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Customer Service Business Analyst I
description:
Job ID: 6395

Functional Area: Customer Service

Position Type: Full-Time Regular

Relocation Provided: No

Location: Topeka, KS

Department: CUSTOMER SVC

Internal / External: Internal

Experience Required: 1 - 3 Years

Position Description:

**PLEASE NOTE:** **This will have a hybrid work schedule with at least two days in office per week(subject to change).** **This posting will close on June 24th.**  
  
**Are you being referred by a ONE Gas employee? If so, reach out to that connection and ask about the employee referral program. They can send you a link to apply directly so they can receive credit!**

**Role Summary**: Partner with the Credit & Collections Manager to be a subject matter expert over Kansas Gas Service credit and collections processes.

**What You Will Do**

Perform entry-level analysis on activities related to the contact centers or business office groups within the Customer Service Department.  
Help prepare and maintain financial spreadsheets and reports such as:

* Budget planning, projections, and forecasting
* Variance analysis
* Third-party contractor financial reports
* Operating and maintenance expenses
* Attrition and headcount trending

Support business analysis to aid management in business decisions and to drive improved performance using performance scorecards, agent statistics, key performance indicators, customer accounts etc.  
Participate in business or vendor process implementation, problem resolution, testing, and training support.  
Participate in compliance monitoring by reviewing information and conducting internal compliance audits.  
Compile data and assist with data mining related to performance statistics, forecasting, budget planning, or other information related to processes or projects using systems such as Banner, CRM Dynamics, Power BI, DebtNext, LexisNexis, Accurint, Community, or PACER.  
Assist with data analysis and reporting using BI databases.  
Perform duties to assist the vendor as a backup for senior business analysts.  
Monitor and provide reports on the number of survey complaints contacted by Contact Center Supervisors to ensure customer complaints are addressed.  
Assist with customer feedback survey reviews to identify customer pain points, successes, and trends related to escalated complaints and web cases.  
Regular and reliable attendance is required in the performance of the job.  
Employee may be required to perform additional duties as requested.

**What You Will Need**

Preferred Bachelor's Degree Business administration, math, statistics, related field, or an equivalent combination of formal education and the following job-related experience:  
Demonstrated ability to complete projects on time while ensuring attention to detail to ensure accuracy.  
Demonstrated ability to organize and prioritize tasks.  
Working knowledge of data compilation and extraction tools.  
Working knowledge of math and algebraic applications to use data for meaningful analysis.  
Demonstrated ability to research and validate data to prepare reports, presentations, or other documentation.  
Knowledge of customer service functions, policies, and procedures.  
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office and ability to use Excel at an intermediate level.  
Demonstrated ability to work together as a team or individually on guided projects.  
Demonstrated ability to read and write fluently in English.  
  
**Diversity at ONE Gas**  
  
Inclusion & Diversity is so important to us that we made it one of our core values, values that guide and direct our actions as we go about our daily business. We know that every employee makes a difference and contributes to our success through their unique talents and abilities. We also acknowledge that we can accomplish great things by listening and learning from each other.

**ONE Gas has great benefits! Here are just a few:**

* Medical/Dental/Vision packages that fit your family's needs.
* Paid Time Off
* 401K is 100% matched up to 6%.
* Profit Sharing Plan
* Paid Parental Leave
* Basic and Operation Employee Term Life Insurance
* Education Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement

Position Requirements:

The job description is not intended to be a complete list of all responsibilities, duties, or skills required for the job and is subject to review and change at any time, with or without notice, in accordance with the needs of One Gas. title: Business Intelligence Manager | Latam Distributors
description:
Ubicación:
Miami, FL, US

Equipo: Desarrollo comercial y de negocios

Tipo de empleo: Permanente

Puig es uno de los principales actores mundiales en la industria de la moda y la belleza. Contamos con un amplio porfolio de marcas de lujo globalmente reconocidas en moda, fragancias, maquillaje, cuidado de la piel y bienestar. Fundada hace más de 100 años, Puig es una empresa familiar que opera con responsabilidad con el entorno y la comunidad y con un firme compromiso a largo plazo hacia nuestras marcas y nuestros empleados.

**La oportunidad**
------------------

In Latam Distributors, we oversee 15 countries in Latin America. The focus of our organization is to support our distributors in these markets to achieve the annual goals.

This position will lead and drive the business intelligence function by delivering strategic data insights across countries, distributors, brands, and retailers. Enable senior leadership, Commercial, and Marketing teams to make data-informed decisions by identifying key trends, performance gaps, and growth opportunities that elevate business unit performance.

**Tus retos**
-------------

* Drive the day-to-day management and maintenance of BI tools, dashboards, and reports to ensure reliable access to key performance data across countries, brands, and distributors.
* Oversee the monthly business performance review cycle, ensuring accuracy and consistency in KPIs such as wholesale, sell-out, stock levels, brand/country coverage, and main key retailers’ performance.
* Lead cross-functional coordination with internal and external teams to standardize and elevate the quality of data submissions and business reporting.
* Develop, launch, and maintain advanced dashboards and data visualization tools that enhance decision-making for Commercial, Marketing, and Leadership teams.
* Collaborate closely with Commercial leadership to identify performance levers, conduct deep-dive analyses, and deliver actionable insights on retailer dynamics, brand performance, and regional trends.
* Promote a data-driven culture by training peers and distributor partners in analytical tools and techniques, improving reporting accuracy and insight generation across the board.
* Contribute to the evolution of Business Intelligence tools and practices by researching and recommending emerging analytics technologies—such as predictive models, automation solutions, or self-service platforms—to enhance reporting efficiency and forward-looking analysis.
* Other similar responsibilities as required.

**Nos encantaría conocerte si tienes**
--------------------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree on business administration, management, data analytics, economics or similar, or the equivalent in experience on data/numerical information analysis.
* High proficiency in MS Office, Excel, Power BI, Power Query; programming experience (e.g., Python, SQL) is a strong advantage.
* Previous experiences in the Luxury or Beauty industry will be an advantage.
* Detail-oriented, analytical thinker with a high degree of autonomy and ownership.
* Ability to coordinate cross-functional stakeholders, build alignment across teams, and support the successful execution of business initiatives.
* Fluent in both Spanish and English, with excellent communication and collaboration skills across regions and cultures.

**¿Qué te aportaremos nosotros?**
---------------------------------

* Una cultura de trabajo emprendedora, creativa y acogedora
* Oportunidades de aprendizaje y desarrollo
* Una empresa internacional con muchas oportunidades de crecimiento profesional
* Un paquete competitivo de compensación y beneficios

Puig ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y todos los solicitantes cualificados serán considerados por igual sin discriminación por razones de raza, color, religión, género, identidad de género, orientación sexual, origen nacional, etnia, edad, discapacidad, estado civil, estado de veterano o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.

En Puig, buscamos personas entusiastas y comprometidas con una amplia gama de conocimientos y experiencias para unirse a nuestro equipo. Creemos que, creando un entorno inclusivo en el que te sientas bienvenido, valorado y empoderado, fortalece nuestro negocio y fomenta una cultura en la que todos nos sentimos inspirados a trabajar, innovar y a desafiarnos a nosotros mismos. Además, creemos que la diversidad de nuestros empleados nos convierte en una empresa más fuerte y más capaz de servir a nuestros clientes en todo el mundo.

title: Auditor, Senior Contract Compliance
description:
Make the most of your talents in a collaborative work environment driven by people who produce results. Enjoy corporate strength, stability, and a rewarding career at a growing industry-leading and diverse company with a track record for success. Tap into the professional possibilities of Enterprise Products.

The Senior Contract Compliance Auditor is a member of the Internal Audit Department reporting directly to the Contract Compliance Audit Director. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

* Perform audits of midstream agreements applicable to joint ventures, partnerships, gathering, processing, transportation and other commercial services. Audit work involves effectively collaborating with internal personnel such as commercial and accounting, and external parties.
* Perform audits of suppliers and contractors providing services for company construction/capital and operational projects. Audit work involves effectively collaborating with internal personnel such as supply chain, procurement, accounting, engineering and operations, and external parties.
* Assist Internal Audit co-workers on process audits and reviews as needed.
* Assist in investigations when assigned by Internal Audit management.
* When assigned, assist with Internal Audit’s coordination (hosting) of external auditors performing audits of Enterprise Products operated assets.
* Represent Internal Audit at internal meetings and with external organizations.
* Pursue career development opportunities to add value to Enterprise Products and Internal Audit.

**Qualifications**  

The successful candidate will meet the following qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree is required. Accounting, finance, economics or marketing degree preferred.
* Minimum 4 years of experience in auditing or a combination of auditing, accounting, and commercial business analysis is required.
* Experience with auditing energy industry agreements applicable to joint ventures, partnerships, gathering, processing, transportation and other commercial services, and vendor/contactor services.
* Knowledgeable of audit profession practices and procedures, common energy industry terminology and COPAS guidelines.
* Maintain a harmonious working relationship with internal and external contacts.
* Willingness to work within a team setting listening to and taking direction from other Internal Audit members.
* Confident to share productive work ideas and experiences.
* Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, with all levels of the organization and external parties.
* Demonstrate proficiency with Microsoft applications (Excel, Word).
* Proficient in oral communications and the ability to effectively draft notes, emails and reports.
* Must be organized, self-motivated, eager to learn and a critical thinker.
* Dependable, accountable, detail oriented and demonstrate integrity.
* Must be available to travel up to 15%.
* Data analytics and visualization experience (IDEA, Alteryx, Power BI) is preferred.
* Experience with Wdesk, Oracle and midstream commercial applications is preferred.

**Primary Location****:** USA-Texas-Houston

**Shift****:** Day Job

**Travel****:** Yes, 25 % of the Time

**Unposting Date****:** Ongoing

**Organization****:** Internal Audit

**Job****:** Accounting

**Job Level****:** Individual Contributor

title: Sr Business Data Analyst
description:
**Sr Business Data Analyst**

Are you a passionate leader looking for autonomy and exciting career possibilities? Do you take an energetic and resourceful approach to problem-solving while bringing innovative ideas and analytics to life on behalf of your team and your customers? Do you enjoy effectively translating requirements into an efficient process and/or system solution? If so, DHL Supply Chain has the opportunity for you.

**Job Description**

To apply knowledge and analytics to develop and communicate timely, accurate, and actionable insight to the business through the use of modeling, visualization, and optimization. Responsible for the reporting, analyzing, and predicting of operational processes, performance, and Key Performance Indicators. Communication with site leadership, operations, and finance on efficiency, customer requirements, account specific issues, and insight into to the business, operations, and customer.

  

* Applies hindsight, insight, and foresight techniques to communicate complex findings and recommendations to influence others to take action
* Uses knowledge of business and data structure to discover and/or anticipate problems where data can be used to solve the problem
* Uses spreadsheets, databases, and relevant software to provide ongoing analysis of operational activities
* Applies data visualization for discovery and timely insights to decrease Cycle Time to Action (CTA)
* Assists site operations in identifying areas for improving service levels, reducing operational costs, and providing other operational enhancements
* Supports account start-up analysis and/or report implementation as needed
* Develop standardized and ad hoc site and/or customer reporting
* Streamlines and/or automates internal and external reporting
* May investigate and recommend new technologies and information systems
* May conduct feasibility analyses on various processes and equipment to increase efficiency of operations
* Partners with Finance to develop financial models to analyze productivity and payroll; calculates cost benefits and business impact and proposes solutions
* Develops predictive models to help drive decision making
* Designs, develops, and implements data gathering and reporting methods and procedures for Operations
* Coordinates with Operations Systems group to ensure technical issues and problems are being identified, addressed, and resolved in a timely manner
* May coordinate with ILD group on issues related to modeling customer solutions, including providing data and relevant insight for customer pursuits
* Responsible for assisting finance and senior leadership in modeling yearly labor budget based on operational and profile changes

**Required Education and Experience**

* Undergraduate degree in business, logistics, mathematics, statistics, related field, or equivalent experience, required
* 1+ years of analytics experience, required

Our Organization has a business casual environment and focuses on teamwork, associate development, training, and continuous improvement. We offer competitive wages, excellent affordable insurance benefits (including health, dental, vision and life), 401K plan, paid vacation and holidays.

Our Organization is an equal opportunity employer.

  
  
Brand: DHL
  
Address: 12621 Featherwood Dr. Ste 390 Houston, TX - 77034
  
Property Description: 5413 - Houston TX SWRC
  
Property Number: 5413

title: Senior Technology Consultant, Power BI
description:
When you care deeply about the work you do, it’s rewarding to see it through from concept to completion. We partner with clients to provide both program management and construction management to strategize, plan, and implement projects that drive organizations forward. From hospitals and airports to university campuses, mass transit systems, water treatment facilities, mines, and wind farms, we've successfully managed thousands of projects.

Joining our team, turning visionary ideas into reality, will shape your future—and the future of your community.

Your Opportunity

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Senior Technology Support Consultant to join our dynamic and growing Programs and Construction Management (PMCM) team. The ideal candidate will be working closely with Controls Specialists and Controls Managers to collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets by developing dashboards and reports to help inform business decisions. In this role, you will also work closely with Controls Leadership to develop and implement standards for technology usage within the group and linking component subsystems to work together as a coherent unit for program management. Key Responsibilities:

* Collect and analyze large datasets to derive actionable insights.
* Use statistical methods to interpret data and generate useful business reports.
* Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data.
* Ensure data accuracy and integrity through validation and cleaning processes.
* Collaborate with the Controls team and other teams to resolve data-related issues.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive and visually appealing reports and dashboards.
* Communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
* Design, Implement, and Integrate technology solutions
* Mentor and develop junior staff on development of reports
* Assist with Business Process development regarding data gathering and analysis
﻿

Your Capabilities and Credentials

* Proficient in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
* Ability to work with large complex data models
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI is strongly preferred, but similar alternatives may be considered).
* Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL processes.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent written/verbal communication and collaboration abilities.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to multi-task, manage time, organize, and set priorities and make timely decisions Preferred Qualifications:
* Experience with large public sector programs in water or transportation
* Prior work in project controls
* Experience with API calls and management (e.g., REST)
* Experience with Middleware tools (e.g., Boomi, Power Automate)
* Previous leadership and management of teams

Education and Experience

* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering)
* Minimum 10 years’ experience in a similar role.
* Advanced degree in relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration) is preferred
* Strong Power BI (or similar) experience is required.
* Industry-specific knowledge and experience (e.g., Architecture, Engineering, Construction).

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

title: Senior Pega Business Analyst
description:
**Infosys is seeking** **Senior Pega Business Analyst****. As a Senior Pega Business Analyst, you will be a key player in the consulting team that helps discover and define the problem statement, evaluates the solution options and makes recommendations. You will create detailed design, architecture and process artifacts and implement the deployment plan. You will also support knowledge transfer with the objective of providing value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Required Qualifications**
---------------------------

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education
* At least 4 years of experience in Information Technology
* Location for this position is Plano, TX. This position requires relocation and/or travel.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* At least 3 years of hands-on experience in application development in Pega PRPC v7.x/V8.x and Pega frameworks
* At least 2 years of experience in creating requirement specifications based on Architecture/Design /Detailing of Processes
* Experience in participating in the requirement gathering/elicitation phase, identifying and defining requirements, use cases, process flows, screen flows, and user interfaces
* Experience in functioning as a technical business analyst by understanding business requirements and transforming those requirements into data mapping specs.
* Experience in communicating and conducting walkthrough sessions for product requirements to architects, engineers, development managers, product managers, testers, and other stakeholders.
* Experience in maintaining and managing the scope of requirements for the Pega application/platform.
* Experience in managing the translation of customer requirements into requirement specifications and Use Cases.
* Knowledge on Pega Case Management
* Understanding on Pega/Appian BPM process
* A holistic view of application functional knowledge to manage IT and Business is preferred
* BPM Certification is preferred

**The job may entail extensive travel. The job may also entail sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Candidates should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  
**About Us**  
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.  
  
**Infosys provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race; color; sex; gender identity; sexual orientation; religious practices and observances; national origin; pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; status as a protected veteran or spouse/family member of a protected veteran; or disability.**

title: Talent Network - Product Management Consultant
description:
**Accelerate your career at Stride**

At our core, we are a learning culture who takes care of each other and acts with integrity. We are trusted technology partners with some of the biggest names revolutionizing the tech industry. From scaling startups to Fortune 500 companies, we help our clients reach their goals by providing collaborative high-end technical consulting, agile transformation, and product delivery.

**Why Stride**

Learn, practice, teach. You’ve invested in your career to become a great Product Manager, now it’s time to share it with some of the most exciting tech companies who are dying to become more product and user-centric! At Stride, you’ll work with excellent teams who care about adding value and improving themselves and everyone around them. Work for one company, impact many!

**What you’ll work on day-to-day**

* Lead and execute product strategy on client engagements to deliver recognized value and earn consistently high NPS scores
* Support team autonomy through clear communication of business and user value
* Empower team members to feel a sense of ownership and accountability through translating value to work and partnering to collectively problem solve
* Align team and stakeholders expectations to shape engagements with prospective clients, ensuring that outcomes are achievable
* Navigate complex interpersonal and technical environments, and uncover solutions to complex problems.
* Build trust with members of the client organization, enabling conversations about additional areas where Stride can contribute
* Manage team priorities through data-informed decision making while demonstrating measurable progress

**Here’s what we're looking for**

* 4+ years of experience working with agile engineering teams and cross-functional organizations
* Advised and managed expectations of management and stakeholders, earning trust and building durable relationships
* Can conduct user research, customer interviews, and lean experiments
* Consistently experiment with new methods and tools
* Bring experience facilitating workshops and Agile ceremonies
* Experience with business analysis, case writing, and financial modeling a plus

**Important Information:**

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; and other business and organizational needs. The range of starting pay for this role is $130,000 – $200,000. For more information about our company and benefits programs, please visit stridenyc.com/careers.

*Stride Consulting is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Stride Consulting is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.*

title: Operations Analyst
description:
*Joining King’s Hawaiian makes you part of our `ohana (family). We are a family-owned business for over seventy years, respecting our roots while thinking about our future as we continue to grow and care for our customers and the communities we serve. Our `ohana members build an environment of inclusivity as they freely collaborate, pursue learning through curiosity, and explore innovation as critical thinkers. Beyond that, we are also passionate about supporting the long-term health and well-being of our employees and their families. If you’re excited to rise with our team, come and join our `ohana!*

Working as an individual contributor under the Continuous Improvement Manager, the Operations Analyst will deliver value to Kings Hawaiian by providing accessible, accurate, and timely performance data and reporting to Operations using tools like Power BI, SQL and Python. The Operations Analyst will work collaboratively with the Continuous Improvement, Production and Data teams to garner insights, identify and scope improvement opportunities, and provide analytical support during opportunity realization. They will also drive the design, improvement, execution, and automation of dashboards and reporting tools with the Operations teams as well as provide guidance and support in the pursuit of self-service tool development. Employees in this position may interact with their leader several times a week to receive guidance and feedback. Some non-routine activities may require their leader’s advance approval, but routine decisions within the general scope of the role may be made independently.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Performance Measurement & Reporting

* Ensure timely and accurate reporting of key operational performance metrics.
* Maintain data integrity by collaborating with Data teams to improve data collection, cleanliness, and governance.
* Interpret operational data with a deep understanding of its real-world implications.
* Serve as a key resource for data analytics needs across Continuous Improvement, Operations Excellence, and Production teams.

Performance Analysis & Opportunity Identification

* Analyze operational data to identify, quantify, and prioritize performance improvement opportunities.
* Partner with stakeholders to validate findings and contextualize insights.
* Provide analytical support for the execution and tracking of improvement initiatives.
* Assist in the development of capital project business cases and value realization tracking, continuously refining valuation methodologies.

Tool Ownership & Support

* Act as the subject matter expert (SME) for frontline performance tracking tools (e.g., RedZone, SAP Digital Manufacturing).
* Lead the design, enhancement, and automation of dashboards and reporting tools.
* Support the development of self-service analytics capabilities across Operations.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

* Communicate insights and recommendations effectively across all levels of the organization—from frontline teams to senior leadership.
* Provide ad hoc analytical support for strategic initiatives within the Continuous Improvement and Operations Excellence functions.
* Perform other duties as assigned, aligned with the scope and intent of the role.

BASIC AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE)

* Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Engineering, Industrial Operations, or a related field; or equivalent relevant experience.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in data analysis, continuous improvement, or a related operational role.
* Highly Proficient in Data Analysis including significant experience and comfort with Python and SQL or other related data analysis skills
* Proficient in Data Visualization tools, including Tableau and Power BI
* Highly Proficient in the Microsoft Suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, and others

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS (JOB SKILLS, ABILITIES, KNOWLEDGE)

* Understanding of traditional manufacturing metrics preferred (OEE, yield, productivity, etc.)
* Clear communicator, able to speak to all levels of the organization
* Expert attention to detail and natural ownership of work
* Highly curious and natural drive to seek understanding
* Self starter that can work independently, but also able to work collaboratively with various stakeholders
* Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.
* Ability to consistently demonstrate King’s values of excellence, dignity, saying it like it is in a way it can be heard; and curiosity, collaboration, critical thinking and emotional intelligence.

*King's Hawaiian is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our ohana.*
company_description: King's Hawaiian, making irresistible foods since 1950.

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
When you join the team at Unum, you become part of an organization committed to helping you thrive.

Here, we work to provide the employee benefits and service solutions that enable employees at our client companies to thrive throughout life’s moments. And this starts with ensuring that every one of our team members enjoys opportunities to succeed both professionally and personally. To enable this, we provide:

* Award-winning culture
* Inclusion and diversity as a priority
* Performance Based Incentive Plans
* Competitive benefits package that includes: Health, Vision, Dental, Short & Long-Term Disability
* Generous PTO (including paid time to volunteer!)
* Up to 9.5% 401(k) employer contribution
* Mental health support
* Career advancement opportunities
* Student loan repayment options
* Tuition reimbursement
* Flexible work environments

### ***\\*All the benefits listed above are subject to the terms of their individual Plans*** **.**

And that’s just the beginning…

With 10,000 employees helping more than 39 million people worldwide, every role at Unum is meaningful and impacts the lives of our customers. Whether you’re directly supporting a growing family, or developing online tools to help navigate a difficult loss, customers are counting on the combined talents of our entire team. Help us help others, and join Team Unum today!

**General Summary:**
--------------------

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst serves as a subject matter expert in data analysis, visualization, and strategic insight generation. This role leads complex analytics projects, translates data into actionable business intelligence, and collaborates closely with cross-functional teams. The analyst also supports contract negotiations, provides market and competitive insights, and ensures accurate reporting for billing and governance. A key part of this role includes mentoring junior analysts and driving the growth of analytics capabilities across the organization.
  
  
This is a hybrid role that requires a minimum of 2x per week on site at our Portland, ME or Chattanooga, TN campuses.

**Job Specifications**

* Bachelor's Degree preferred, and/or equivalent experience
* 6+ years' experience with demonstrated success at a BI Analyst II level or comparable data analytics related field
* Excellent knowledge of analytics programming languages (SQL/R/Python)
* Excellent knowledge of modern BI toolsets (Tableau, Alteryx, Power BI, or equivalent)
* In-depth understanding of data profiling, statistical analysis and data modeling concepts
* Adept in extracting and leveraging data out of data warehouse, transactional databases, object stores & API based environments
* Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into technical solutions
* Ability to embrace change, adapt to the unexpected, and focus energies, people, and solutions on practical and positive results
* Demonstrated problem solving skills
* Strong communications skills with the ability to influence various levels of leaders using data and logic
* Strong and proven ability to effectively mentor, develop and coach others
* Aptitude and drive to learn new technologies and analysis techniques
* Is comfortable taking responsibility for the design & implementation of technical solutions
* Strong team player; able to work effectively within a team and more broadly with people from a variety of backgrounds and areas across the organization.

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities**

* Utilize business knowledge to understand business needs and provide technical analytics and solutions to meet these needs
* Conduct moderate to complex data profiling and analysis to evaluate data sources to determine the best source for business information
* Acquiring, transforming and translating data into actionable dashboards, reports, algorithms or datasets that has a substantial impact on the functional area of support
* Performing moderate to complex statistical analysis and presenting findings to guide, influence and advise leadership, including at times senior leaders
* Collaborate with data engineers to perform data validation and testing activities as appropriate
* Develop and build upon existing expertise knowledge of the insurance industry, company and competitor landscape
* Develop and build upon existing expertise of data stored in company databases, as well as emerging trends in business intelligence technologies
* Works directly with internal customers to refine requirements and validate output to ensure solutions will meet expectations
* Provide mentoring, coaching and developmental support to lower-level BI Analysts

#LI-AD1

#LI-Hybrid

~IN1

Unum and Colonial Life are part of Unum Group, a Fortune 500 company and leading provider of employee benefits to companies worldwide. title: Strategy Operations Analyst
description:
Posting Description:

**Aon is looking for a Strategy & Operations Analyst in New York, NY, Rochester, NY, or Chicago, IL**

**This is a hybrid role working 2 days per week from one of the above offices.**

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally, lead initiatives, develop business models, and launch new processes and workflows. You will handle operational performance and targets. We are a fast-paced, growing firm where a goal-oriented, hardworking individual can make a difference that impacts thousands of small businesses. We expect substantial growth over the next few years, which means you can expect plenty of opportunities for advancement.

**Aon is in the business of better decisions**

At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.

As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive team and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.

**What the day will look like**

Essential Job Functions:

* Lead strategic business and growth initiatives.
* Conduct strategic analysis, customer/competitor research, and market sizing.
* Own fi nancial modeling and scenario analysis.
* Develop new business models, defi ning org structures, and strategic annual planning that aligns with the company goals.

**Skills and experience that will lead to success**

**Qualifications: Education:**  

* Bachelor’s Degree including analytical coursework (e.g. engineering, economics, finance, statistics, computer science)
* 0 to 4 years working in a consultative role, investment banking, or strategy & operations.

Technical:  

* Sophisticated business modeling skills in Excel and history of producing meticulous outputs.
* Experience solving problems through data analysis

Preferred (but not required):  

* Experience with CRM tools like SalesForce
* Business Intelligence tools such as Looker, Tableau or Sisense, SQL.
* Software and/or software as a service (SaaS) experience

Professional Skills:  

* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
* Willingness to take ownership of initiatives and perform in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills as well as the ability to deliver results in a timely manner.
* Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
* Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments

**How we support our colleagues**

In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage an inclusive workforce. Plus, our agile environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions for our colleagues as well.

Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.

Aon values an innovative and inclusive workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, domestic partner status, or other legally protected status. People with criminal histories are encouraged to apply.

We welcome applications from all and provide individuals with disabilities with reasonable adjustments to participate in the job application, interview process and to perform essential job functions once onboard. If you would like to learn more about the reasonable accommodations we provide, email ReasonableAccommodations@Aon.com

For positions in San Francisco and Los Angeles, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction record in accordance with local Fair Chance ordinances.

***Aon is not accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this position. If you are a search firm, you will not be compensated in any way for your submission of a candidate, even if Aon hires that candidate.***

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

**Salary range or hourly pay range for the position**  
The salary range for this position (intended for U.S. applicants) is $76,000 to $126,000 annually. The actual salary will vary based on applicant’s education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on applicant’s geographic location.

This position is eligible to participate in one of Aon’s annual incentive plans to receive an annual discretionary bonus in addition to base salary. The amount of any bonus varies and is subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable incentive plan.

**A summary of all the benefits offered for this position:**

Aon offers a comprehensive package of benefits for full-time and regular part-time colleagues, including, but not limited to: a 401(k) savings plan with employer contributions; an employee stock purchase plan; consideration for long-term incentive awards at Aon’s discretion; medical, dental and vision insurance, various types of leaves of absence, paid time off, including 12 paid holidays throughout the calendar year, 15 days of paid vacation per year, paid sick leave as provided under state and local paid sick leave laws, short-term disability and optional long-term disability, health savings account, health care and dependent care reimbursement accounts, employee and dependent life insurance and supplemental life and AD&D insurance; optional personal insurance policies, adoption assistance, tuition assistance, commuter benefits, and an employee assistance program that includes free counseling sessions. Eligibility for benefits is governed by the applicable plan documents and policies.

title: Operations Analyst
description:
Basic Qualifications :

Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, or a related Science, Engineering or Mathematics field. Also requires 10+ years of job-related experience, or a Master's degree plus 8 years of job-related experience.

**CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:**

Department of Defense Top Secret security clearance is preferred at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Responsibilities for this Position:

Are you passionate about analyzing and solving complex problems to maximize America’s warfighting capabilities?

Are you intrigued by the opportunity to integrate Air, Space, Surface, Ground, Undersea, or Cyber warfare domains that use state of the art software and computing capabilities?

Are you seeking an opportunity to apply your operations analysis background in a collaborative, engaging, and inquisitive environment?

Do you want to work with sophisticated technologies that have a significant impact to United States national security programs and our military forces’ capabilities?

If this sounds like an environment that would help you foster and grow your interests, consider the General Dynamics Mission Systems team as part of your future. We want you to join our team of innovators and leverage your background in operations analysis to expand capabilities and programs that support the United States Government at the leading edge of technology.

**As an Operations Analyst…**

You will identify patterns and trends within battlefield environments that inform your operational analysis of interacting sensor, tracker, communication, and weapon systems for multi-domain, mission-level operations with the goal of applying your insightful observations to inform approaches, and support decision-making.

You will collaborate with experts in specific warfare domains and technologies to determine how to most effectively integrate key enablers and effects in a multi-domain environment. You will perform operational analysis to discover trends, assess risks, inform options and trade-off analysis, and document uncertainties.

You will have the opportunity to present your analyses through white papers, briefings, and presentations to both technical specialists and pivotal decision makers.

**Qualifications**

Have an MS degree in a technical or scientific field such as Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science, or Software Engineering and between 15-25 years of relevant experience.

Have hands on experience with using modeling and simulation tools and performing analysis.

Understanding of military operations and the best ways to achieve desired outcomes based on given scenarios.

Understanding of military tactics, strategies, and trade-off considerations, ideally to include at the Combatant Command level.

Experience developing or integrating systems in - or across any combination of - Air, Space, Surface, Ground, Undersea, or Cyber warfare domains. Working in and with Special Access communities is preferred.

Can effectively work in a highly collaborative environment as well as independently.

Must possess exceptional written and oral communication skills and have demonstrated experience authoring materials and presenting complex ideas to a variety of internal/external partners.

Have experience on teams that require workload balancing and supporting frequent internal/external engagements.

Possess or can obtain a Top-Secret level clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.

Salary Note: This estimate represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors (geographic location, etc.). Actual pay may vary. This job posting will remain open until the position is filled. Combined Salary Range: USD $186,501.00 - USD $206,900.00 /Yr. Company Overview:

General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 12,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high-performance team!

Equal Opportunity Employer / Individuals with Disabilities / Protected Veterans
company_description: When you join General Dynamics, you’ll become part of a world class team that inspires innovation.

title: Functional Business Consultant Senior - Remote
description:
Our work matters. We help people get the medicine they need to feel better and live well. We do not lose sight of that. It fuels our passion and drives every decision we make.

Job Posting Title

Functional Business Consultant Senior - Remote

Job Description

The Functional Business Consultant serves as a business system or business process subject matter expert with a high level of understanding of their assigned area. This position will represent their area of expertise with regard to business system knowledge on internal and client projects, regulatory requirements, process improvement, advanced research, root cause analysis, complex issue research, documentation, advanced communications, client interaction, training, testing, ongoing system support, and developing reports and coordinating audits.

Responsibilities

* Represents assigned business system or business process as a subject matter expert in business requirements, system specifications, process flows, process change and/or project management
* Provides leadership to the business in the identification and adoption of operational best practices and standard operating procedures as it relates to assigned business system or business process
* Independently researches, determines root cause and collaborates with others to resolve complex business and technical issues and customer inquiries.
* Provides prompt and thorough resolution for client and/or member satisfaction
* May facilitate testing for new or improved systems or processes including creation of a test plan, identifying test cases, and performing or leading User Acceptance and Joint Cycle Testing
* May provide guidance, mentoring, and work direction to others on the team
* Other duties as assigned

Education & Experience

* Bachelor's degree in business administration, IT or related area of study, or equivalent combination of education and/or relevant work experience; HS diploma or GED is required

* 5 years of work experience in business analysis, project management, and/or process improvement to include:##3 years of functional experience in at least one of the specific areas for position (e.g., claims, eligibility, product, benefits, implementations or related area)
* Must be eligible to work in the United States without need for work visa or residency sponsorship

Additional Qualifications

* Proven client service skills with a track record for building strong client relations
* Implementation experience
* Thorough understanding of pharmaceutical claims data and general understanding of medical claims data; highly analytical
* Self learns new processes/software to solve analytic problems
* Expert interpersonal skills necessary to drive results and deliver on commitments in a collaborative fashion
* Skillful at meeting facilitation, conflict management, and consensus building
* Capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously and ability to work under pressure with strict timelines in a fast-paced work environment
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with prior experience giving presentations
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint, and Visio

Preferred Qualifications

* Rx Claims system proficiency
* Previous PBM or healthcare experience
* Advanced experience using queries

Physical Demands

* Occasional non-standard hours and travel may be required
* Constantly required to sit, use hands to handle or feel, talk and hear
* Frequently required to reach with hands and arms
* Occasionally required to stand, walk and stoop, kneel, and crouch
* Occasionally required to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus

Every employee must understand, comply with and attest to the security responsibilities and security controls unique to their job, and comply with all applicable legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements and internal policies and procedures.

Potential pay for this position ranges from $81,000.00 - $138,000.00 based on experience and skills.

*Prime Therapeutics LLC is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We encourage diverse candidates to apply, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected class under federal, state, or local law.*

*We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives including qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records and any qualified applicants requiring reasonable accommodations in accordance with the law.*

*Prime Therapeutics LLC is a Tobacco-Free Workplace employer.*

Positions will be posted for a minimum of five consecutive workdays.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Contractor
description:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business data requirements.
  
  
Design, document, and validate data models and business logic within Data Warehouses.
  
  
Build and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations in Power BI.

title: Business Analyst III (Digital Change Lead)
description:
**About the Team**

We’re not traditional change management—we’re Digital Change Management, redefining digital advancement through AI, data technologies, and human-centered design. As technology evolves, we lead bold, strategic change that shapes the future of our business and employee experience.

We bring a people-first approach to aligning technology with business value, maximizing Zachry’s digital solution investments. In partnership with the Digital Enablement team, we drive adoption and deliver transformative change across the organization.

The Digital Change Lead reports to the Sr. Manager of Digital Change Management and plays a key role in making this vision a reality.

If you're passionate about digital innovation and ready to make a real impact—join us. We’re not just keeping up with change—we’re leading it.

  

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS**

* 4+ years of experience delivering end-to-end change management for complex, high-profile initiatives, ideally in fast-paced or consulting environments.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, communications, or a related field (advanced degree or consulting experience preferred).
* Proven expertise in change management methodologies (e.g., PROSCI) and all phases of the change process, including stakeholder analysis, impact assessments, communications, and adoption planning.
* Strong background in strategic program execution, stakeholder engagement, and cross-functional collaboration.
* Experience with Oracle Cloud HCM implementations or digital transformation initiatives.
* Fluent in English; able to work effectively in a multicultural, team-oriented environment.
* Must pass a post-offer background check, including a drug screen.
* Familiarity with AI integration in workflows, decision-making, or automation, and a forward-thinking mindset toward emerging technologies.

**PREFERRED JOB QUALIFICATIONS**

* Advanced degree in business, communications, I/O psychology or a related field (or consulting experience).
* ACMP’s Certified Change Management Professional (CCMP™) or working toward certification.
* Proficiency with multiple change management tools and methodologies (e.g., ACMP Standard, Prosci ADKAR, Kotter, Lewin).
* Strong project management background
* Digital marketing experience

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES (to be successful in this role)**

* Skilled in developing and delivering strategic communications, executive presentations, and training using digital and video platforms.
* Excellent facilitation, communication, and persuasion skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving capabilities.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, especially advanced PowerPoint and Excel; creative development skills are a plus.
* Deep understanding of change management techniques, tools, and stakeholder engagement strategies.
* Skilled in conflict resolution, active listening, and consensus building.
* Demonstrated business acumen with strong organizational and planning abilities.
* Collaborative team player who thrives in fast-paced, dynamic environments.
* Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and maintain focus on outcomes.
* Comfortable advising executives and navigating tight timelines without compromising quality.
* Data-driven and creative, with a passion for enhancing the employee experience and promoting fact-based decision-making.
* Curious, adaptable, and committed to continuous learning and improvement.
* A natural change agent with a consulting mindset and a drive to challenge the status quo.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 5 pounds; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, walking, twisting, and kneeling to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office environment.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

Will work in a general office environment with a hybrid work schedule. Employees are required to work at least three (3) days a week on site. Remote work or working at the Zachry Houston office possible, based on the scenario. Capable of operating and functioning in a fast-paced work environment. Must possess a vision (corrected or uncorrected) that allows for clear visibility from a distance of 20 inches or less.

Zachry Group is America's pacesetter in turnkey construction, engineering, maintenance, turnaround and fabrication services in the power, energy, chemicals, manufacturing and industrial sectors. We work with customers to plan, build and renew their most critical facilities, so they can achieve their immediate and long-term goals, all at the highest safety standards. We operate 35 offices, with an average of 20,000 employees working in more than 400 locations nationwide, united by shared sets of values and the desire to deliver the very best outcome for our customers. Visit www.zachrygroup.com for more information.

**ZACHRY GROUP** is dedicated to providing a Safe and Drug Free work environment; and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**Company Benefits** : Meaningful Work ; Team-Based Culture ; Opportunity for Growth

title: Data Business Analyst II - Hybrid
description:
Our Fortune 500 company is driving a digital transformation and looking for forward-thinking innovators to disrupt how our industry thinks about and uses technology. As one of the world's leading employee benefits providers, we help millions of people gain affordable access to benefits that help them protect their families, their finances and their futures.

Are you an asker of questions, a solver of problems, and a challenger of the status quo? Our mission is to provide a differentiated customer experience and exceed the expectations people have of technology at any company — not just insurers.

We are seeking individuals to join our team of talented IT professionals who share never-ending passion and an unwavering focus on our customer experience. Team members comfortable working in an agile, fast-paced, and delivery-focused environment thrive in our environment where we value an entrepreneurial spirit and those who challenge the status-quo.

Unum is changing, and we’re excited about what’s next. Join us.

**General Summary:**
--------------------

The Data Business Analyst serves as a critical liaison between the Scrum team and business stakeholders, ensuring alignment and clarity around business requirements. This role is responsible for eliciting, defining, and documenting requirements, including the development of clear acceptance criteria.
  
  
Additionally, the analyst may conduct data profiling, analysis, and mapping for tasks ranging from simple to moderately complex. This position involves performing moderately complex data analysis, preparation, and visualization. Leveraging both technical and domain expertise, the analyst translates data into actionable insights that empower teams and leadership to make informed decisions. The role requires minimal supervision and demonstrates proficiency with relevant tools and technologies within the data domain.
  
  
The ideal candidate is a creative and analytical thinker with a strong passion for data. They will collaborate closely with Principal Business Analysts, Product Owners, Delivery Leads, Data Engineers, and business units to gather and validate requirements. Active participation in work estimation and delivery planning is also expected.

**Job Specifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree preferred, and/or equivalent experience
* 2+ years of experience with demonstrated success at the Associate level in Data Analysis or equivalent experience, and working as part of an Agile team
* Takes an innovative approach to problem-solving
* Strong written communication skills to document and communicate requirements
* Knowledge of SQL
* Understanding of data profiling and analysis concepts, including data anomalies and data mapping activities.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks by paying close attention to detail
* Ability to embrace change, adapt to the unexpected, and focus energies, people, and solutions on practical and positive results
* Strong team player; able to work effectively within a team and more broadly with people from a variety of backgrounds and areas across the organization.
* Self-motivated and results-oriented

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with stakeholders across business and technical teams (e.g., architects, developers, UX, engineers) to define and refine user stories and requirements with clear acceptance criteria.
* Translate business objectives into user stories, workflows, and data-driven features that support modernization efforts and the consolidation of legacy applications.
* Lead backlog grooming and decomposition, ensuring alignment with enterprise quality standards, planning horizons, and data integrity across tools.
* Elicit and document business requirements through interviews, workshops, workflow analysis, and systems documentation
* Participate in and support Agile ceremonies, including daily stand-ups, planning, retrospectives, and test activities.
* Serve as a change agent by identifying, evaluating, and implementing process improvements and innovations that reduce waste and increase delivery efficiency.
* Conduct data profiling and analysis to evaluate data sources to determine the best source for business information.
* Complete source to target data mapping specifications (e.g. source to target can be from one DBMS table to another DBMS table, from a DBMS table into a canonical message structure, etc.)
* Develop and maintain knowledge of the insurance industry.
* Develop and maintain knowledge of data stored in company databases.
* Adhere to approved architectural standards.
* Thinks with the mind of the end customer at all times, ensuring solutions seek to improve the customer experience and delight their customers.

title: Senior Product Owner - Hybrid
description:
When you join the team at Unum, you become part of an organization committed to helping you thrive.

Here, we work to provide the employee benefits and service solutions that enable employees at our client companies to thrive throughout life’s moments. And this starts with ensuring that every one of our team members enjoys opportunities to succeed both professionally and personally. To enable this, we provide:

* Award-winning culture
* Inclusion and diversity as a priority
* Performance Based Incentive Plans
* Competitive benefits package that includes: Health, Vision, Dental, Short & Long-Term Disability
* Generous PTO (including paid time to volunteer!)
* Up to 9.5% 401(k) employer contribution
* Mental health support
* Career advancement opportunities
* Student loan repayment options
* Tuition reimbursement
* Flexible work environments

### ***\\*All the benefits listed above are subject to the terms of their individual Plans*** **.**

And that’s just the beginning…

With 10,000 employees helping more than 39 million people worldwide, every role at Unum is meaningful and impacts the lives of our customers. Whether you’re directly supporting a growing family, or developing online tools to help navigate a difficult loss, customers are counting on the combined talents of our entire team. Help us help others, and join Team Unum today!

**General Summary:**
--------------------

We’re seeking a Senior Product Owner to play a critical role in driving continuous improvement and modernization within Unum’s Long-Term Care (LTC) systems. Rather than owning a single product or Scrum team, this individual will manage work across two Scrum teams and partner with existing Product Owners.
  
  
The Senior Product Owner will focus on business alignment, delivery accountability, and stakeholder engagement, ensuring business requirements are well defined, communicated, and successfully translated into technical delivery.
  
  
This is a highly collaborative and visible role that requires both technical fluency and strong business acumen. The ideal candidate thrives in Agile environments, can navigate legacy systems, and brings strong communication and organizational skills to manage complexity across teams.
  
  
Location: Hybrid, onsite at our Portland, ME, Chattanooga, TN or Atlanta (Sandy Springs), GA campus.

**Job Specs:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
* 5+ years of Product Owner or Senior Business Analyst experience, preferably within Agile frameworks
* Deep understanding of Agile methodologies, backlog management, and stakeholder alignment
* Familiarity with tools such as Rally, Smartsheet, and data platforms like Snowflake
* Strong communication and facilitation skills across both business and technical teams
* Ability to manage across multiple initiatives and hold teams accountable for deliverables
* Demonstrated success translating complex business needs into actionable requirements
* Experience within insurance or regulated industries preferred, but not required
Must be highly organized, self-directed, and collaborative with a focus on outcomes  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Serve as a cross-functional leader managing shared workstreams across two Scrum teams; provide oversight and support to team-level Product Owners
* Liaise with business stakeholders to understand goals, define requirements, and ensure alignment on priorities, risks, and progress
* Collaborate with developers, analysts, and business leads to ensure smooth translation of business needs into deliverables
* Participate in daily standups, backlog grooming, and planning sessions using tools like Rally and Smartsheet
* Own accountability for the delivery of key system improvements within the LTC domain, focusing on process-oriented solutions over individual product features
* Update leadership and stakeholders regularly on delivery progress, risks, and dependencies
* Lead and support continuous improvement initiatives to enhance delivery performance and product quality
* Learn and navigate legacy systems and Snowflake as needed to support business data and platform needs
* Uphold Unum’s Agile standards and coach others on best practices when needed

title: Manager, Business Intelligence IS
description:
**MANAGER, BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE IS**

**WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?**

The Business Intelligence Manager is responsible for conceptualization to implementation of both tactical and strategic data warehousing, reporting and analytics solutions for the Enterprise Analytics Business Intelligence team. Day to day responsibilities include oversight of Enterprise BI platforms, management of daily BI production activities, and supporting projects requiring BI solutions. The BI Manager is also responsible for defining Enterprise level refining BI vision and strategy and implementing new BI or analytic products and services to address shifting market and BI tool trends to increase BI delivery efficiency.

**WHAT WILL YOU DO?**

* Plans and manages BI needs & development for strategic BI platforms - SAP Business Objects and Tabelau
* Provides both strategic as well as tactical input on the Data warehouse architecture and data model.
* Evaluates, selects and implements new technologies and development tools for reporting, dashboards, data modeling, ETL design and development.
* Builds, leads and develops the BI team consisting of highly motivated (onsite and remote resources.
* Responsible for managing a team of colleagues including workload, provide coaching and annual performance appraisal; participating in the selection of new hires and making recommendations for personal development, promotion and terminations; inspiring and leading team to perform at optimum levels.
* Plans and establishes go-live activities including ongoing production support and various SLAs.
* Interacts with business stakeholders and other groups within the IT organization to understand data and reporting needs & manage expectations for ongoing delivery.
* Represents the Bank by actively participating in outside civic and community affairs, business and industry related organizations, and other professional activities as appropriate.
* Fosters and maintains good relationships with colleagues to ensure that processes are integrated to support expected customer service levels.
* It is the individual responsibility of every employee to maintain a current awareness and understanding of appropriate banking laws, regulations, internal policies and procedures, and to comply fully with those laws, regulations, policies and procedures.
* Responsible and accountable for appropriate quality controls related to the financial products the bank provides, the services the bank delivers, the processes employed and the incentives with which colleagues are awarded.

**WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?**

**Required Qualifications\\***

* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
* 5+ years of leading Business Intelligence teams
* 5+ years of Finance and Banking industry experience.

**Additional Qualifications**

* BS or MS in Computer Science or a related technical field preferred.
* Supervision experience required with demonstrated success using information to drive understanding and business decisions.
* Knowledge of System Life Cycles (requirements, functional design, technical design, implementation guide, user help, and support or troubleshooting documentation).
* Hands-on experience working with Oracle 11G, SAP Business Objects BI 3.1 or higher, SAP Business Objects Data Services 4.0 highly preferred.
* Outstanding English written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to author and deliver presentations.
* Demonstrated ability to interface and effectively communicate with multiple levels of management.
* Organized, detail-oriented, and ability to multi-task.
* Strong organizational, planning and time management skills.
* Strong strategic thinking, problem solving, critical thinking and conflict resolution skills.
* Strong intellectual and business acumen.
* Strong leadership, partnership or consultancy skills.
* Ability to work efficiently with peers, end users, senior management, and outside vendors.
* Awareness of corporate objectives and initiatives.
* Ability to influence, motivate, persuade and build confidence and trust.
* Ability to be proactive when working with various groups that have different opinions and priorities within the enterprise.
* Capable of transitioning knowledge of management to others. Creates an environment of teamwork.
* Working knowledge of the solutions implemented as part of the BI strategy.

**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?**

**Compensation**

Starting base salary: $122,535 - $208,715 per year. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. This job is eligible for bonus and/or commissions.

**Benefits and Perks**

At City National, we strive to be the best at whatever we do, including the benefits and perks we offer our colleagues including:

* Comprehensive healthcare coverage, including Medical, Dental and Vision plans, available the first of the month following start date
* Generous 401(k) company matching contribution
* Career Development through Tuition Reimbursement and other internal upskilling and training resources
* Valued Time Away benefits including vacation, sick and volunteer time
* Specialized health and family planning benefits including fertility benefits, and cancer, diabetes and musculoskeletal support programs
* Career Mobility support from a dedicated recruitment team
* Colleague Resource Groups to support networking and community engagement

Get a more detailed look at our Benefits and Perks.

**ABOUT US**

Since day one we've always gone further than the competition to help our clients, colleagues and communities flourish. City National Bank was founded in 1954 by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs and that legacy of integrity, community and unparalleled client relationships continues today. City National is a subsidiary of Royal Bank of Canada, one of North America's leading diversified financial services companies. To learn more about City National and our dynamic company culture, visit us at About Us.

**INCLUSION AND EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT**

City National Bank fosters an inclusive environment where all forms of diversity are valued and leveraged to make us a better company and employer. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other basis protected by law.  
  
It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.
